El señor Cesar y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren superarse para lo cual se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de terreno agrícola en la población de Tíraque.
texts.en: Cesar is 25 years old.  He is single but living with his partner.  He managed to attend primary school and now has three young daughters, for whom he is financially responsible.  Cesar's main income comes from locksmithing.  He works in his brother's workshop, which is located in the town of Tírque.  At the same time, he makes a living in agriculture, growing potatoes and wheat on his own land.  The land is in the community of Laguna, which is in the town of Araní.  Finally, it must also be mentioned that Cesar's wife sells popcorn in Tíraque, especially during term-time,and this generates additional income.  Cesar and his wife have shown themselves to be hard-working and responsible people who want to overcome problems.  To do this, they need to apply for a loan in order to buy agricultural land in Tíraque.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: María Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Tienen 37 años de edad, vive en la zona de Chacacollo una zona de la provincia de Sacaba de la ciudad de Cochabamba. La Señora Hilda  quien tiene dos hijos pequeños que dependen económicamente de ella, trabaja como obrera en la Empresa Nordland ya como dos años atrás y su otra actividad ella tiene una vivienda amplia donde da en alquiler algunas de sus habitaciones.     La señora Hilda trabajo desde muy pequeña ya que ella se crio solo con la tía ya que sus padres fallecieron cuando ella era pequeña desde entonces tuvo que salir adelante trabajaba como empleada doméstica, después empezó a con la producción del maíz en los terrenos de la tía y desde entonces ella está acostumbrada a realizar diversos trabajos, ella explica que no tienen vergüenza ni tampoco miedo de trabajar de lo que fuera para sacar adelante a sus hijos.                         
 La señora Hilda está divorciada ya que su esposo la dejo y quien tiene ahora otra familia, ella explica que quiere una mejor vida para su familia en especial para sus dos pequeños y sueña con que ellos puedan terminar el colegio y realizar una carrera ya que ella no tuvo ningún estudio. La señora Hilda requiere el crédito para la compra de semillas ya que quiere sembrar maíz en un terreno que le dejo la Tía, la señora Hilda es una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Hilda is 37 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman who lives in Chacacollo, in the province of Sacaba, in the city of Cochabamba. Hilda has two small children who are financially dependent on her. She has worked for a company called Nordland for the last two years while also renting out rooms in her house. Hilda began working at a young age because she grew up with just her aunt. Her parents died when she was a little girl, so she had to learn to get ahead, working as a housekeeper. Later, she began growing corn to sell on her aunt's land. Since then, she has worked in various jobs at the same time. 

Hilda is neither ashamed nor afraid of working tirelessly to help her children get ahead. She has been divorced since her husband left her and began another family. Hilda aims to improve her family's quality of life, especially for her two children. She dreams that they will finish high school and begin a career that she never had the opportunity to study and pursue. 

Hilda is requesting this loan to buy seeds so that she can grow corn on the land her aunt left her.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing corn.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia tiene 58 años de edad, vive en la Comunidad de Tacuara, tiene un hijo que depende de ella y es el que le apoya en las diferentes actividades agrícolas que realiza la señora Julia.                                                                                                               Actualmente doña Julia se dedica a la siembra de maní y maíz blando estos productos lo siembra en terrenos propios de ella, el diario vivir de doña Julia es muy sacrificado y agotador ya que las actividades agrícolas son de muchos sacrificios para producir los mismos.  Los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y otros, por ese motivo ella tomo la decisión de solicitar este crédito, para poder conservar y combatir las malezas de su siembra de Maní y Maíz (Fumigado de siembra) principalmente, con esta inversión ella quiere mejorar sus ingresos que le permita mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 58 years old. She lives in the Tacuara community and has a son who is dependent on her and who helps her with the different agricultural tasks she engages in.

Doña Julia currently plants peanuts and corn in her own fields. Her daily life is exhausting and full of sacrifices because farming these crops requires a good deal of sacrifice. Nevertheless, her earnings are not sufficient to cover the costs of food, clothing and other necessities. Thus she made the decision to request this loan so that she can preserve her peanut and cornfields, principally by clearing the undergrowth and fumigating at sowing. With this investment she wants to increase her earnings so that she will be able to improve her and her son’s standard of living.

loans.use: to spray her crops.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es: El Sr. Ciriaco tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la Población de Mariposas, de la provincia Carrasco, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él está en concubinato con la Sra. Emeteria. Ciriaco tiene 7 hijos,  se dedica a la producción de plátano y la producción de cacao ya que el no pudo tener ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, ellos vivían en el departamento de Potosí  hace 31 años atrás ellos se volvieron a levantar  junto a su Esposa tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Ciriaco es para la compra de Rondanas para Cablevia  y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar alguna carrera sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos y quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Ciriaco is 55 years old.  He lives in the town of Mariposas in the Carrasco province in the city of Cochabamba.  He is married to Emeteria and they have seven children.  He works growing bananas and producing cacao.  They used to live in the department of Potosi, and he was not able to earn enough money to support their family, so 31 years ago, they returned to take a new path, starting from nothing.  

Ciriaco is requesting this loan to purchase pulleys for a cable system for his banana plants.  This will allow him to earn more income and help his children finish their career.  He dreams of giving his children a better future and hopes that they will become professionals and be able to help people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase pulleys for a cable system.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es: VIRGILIO ES UNA PERSONA MUY JOVEN SOLTERO, ÉL VIVE CON SUS PADRES Y CON SU PEQUEÑO HIJO QUE QUEDO HUÉRFANO DE MADRE CUANDO SOLO TENIA UN AÑO DE EDAD POR ACCIDENTE DE MOVILIDAD, VIRGILIO  CON  31 AÑOS DE  EDAD   DESDE MUY JOVEN SE DEDICO  A TRABAJAR EN  LA AGRICULTURA JUNTO CON SUS HERMANOS, QUE TAMBIÉN MUY PRONTO DECIDIERON IR A BUSCAR MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A OTRAS PROVINCIAS, VIRGILIO NO SOLO ES PADRE Y MADRE PARA SU HIJO SINO QUE CUIDA DE SUS PADRES QUE POR LA EDAD YA NO PUEDEN TRABAJAR EN EL CAMPO. POR EL GRAN SACRIFICIO QUE REALIZA VIRGILIO ES MUY QUERIDO  Y RESPETADO EN SU COMUNIDAD, CON EL  CRÉDITO QUE ESTÁ SOLICITANDO EL DESEA INVERTIR MÁS EN SUS CULTIVOS, COMPRANDO  SEMILLAS Y ABONOS  PARA RECUPERAR ALGO DE LO PERDIDO DE SU ANTERIOR  COSECHA Y DE ESA MANERA MEJORAR SU  CALIDAD DE VIDA Y AYUDAR A TODA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Virgilio is a young single man.  He lives with his parents and his young son whose mother died in an auto accident when he was only a year old.  Virgilio is 31 years old, and since he was very young, he has worked as a farmer together with his brothers, who soon decided to look for better living conditions in other provinces.  Virgilio is not only a mother and father to his son, but he also cares for his parents since they are at an age where they can not work in the fields.  Virgilio is loved and respected in his community for the sacrifices he has made.  

He is requesting this loan because he wants to invest more in his crops by purchasing seeds and fertilizer.  He hopes to recover some of the losses from his last harvest and improve his quality of life and help his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Deybi

texts.es: El señor Deybi tiene 29 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando en la universidad, iba en el primer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese más independiente. Actualmente alquilo una habitación en la zona de Quintanilla - Sacaba - Chapare y vivió solo. El solicitante trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano, tiene 2 años de experiencia, trabaja de lunes a sábado, en el radio taxi línea dorada, sus principales gastos son la reparación, mantenimiento del vehículo y la compra de combustible diario.  El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un nuevo motor, ya que el actual se arruino y el cliente no tiene el suficiente ahorro para comprar uno nuevo, además de que este préstamo será destinado al pago de los servicios de un mecánico que realizara el cambio de motor.
texts.en: Deybi is 29 years old and single. He does not live with a partner nor has any children or dependent relatives. After finishing high school, he started university but had to drop out before completing his first year because of his lack of financial resources. He was living with his parents but they decided to stop supporting him in order to help him become independent. Deybi then rented a room in the Quintanilla - Sacaba - Chapare area and started living on his own. He has been working in urban transport for two years. He works Monday to Saturday as a taxi driver, and is member of a taxi network called "Línea dorada" ("Golden Line"). His costs include repairs and maintenance on his vehicle, as well as the cost of daily petrol refills. He asks for this loan in order to buy a new engine, since the current one is all but done for, and he does not have enough funds at the ready to buy a new one. The loan will also go towards paying for the mechanic who will change the engine.

loans.use: to change his taxi's engine.

loans.name: Carmen Nelida

texts.es: La señora Carmen se dedica al servicio de costura desde hace 12 años,  necesita un préstamo para la compra de máquina de costura  ya que actualmente ella está viviendo sola y necesita aumentar sus ingresos y para ello necesita nueva máquina, y comprar más material  de costura. La señora Carmen al quedar sola después de su separación  está pasando por momentos difíciles, pero aun así  es perseverante en su trabajo. Ella está muy contenta de poder acceder a esta oportunidad y poder  seguir en el rubro de costura, ella vive en un domicilio en anticrético, gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo de esta manera demuestra que tiene  ganas de superación independiente, con la compra de la nueva  máquina podrá realizar más y diferentes trabajos de costura con lo cual podrá cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en: For 12 years Carmen has been making her living providing sewing services. She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine as she is currently living alone and needs to increase her income: to do so, she needs a new machine. As Carmen has been alone since her separation, she is going through a difficult moment but even still she is resolute in her work. She is very content to have been able to have access to this opportunity and continue working in the field of sewing. She lives in an anticrético [a Bolivian rental agreement in which the rent is paid up front] thanks to the hard work in which she shows a great desire to get ahead in life on her own. Through the purchase of this new machine, she will be able to more and different types of sewing items with which she will be able to cover her costs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bello Amanecer está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país,  el lugar se caracteriza por ser un lugar productor de leche, cuajada, queso. Estas personas son trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos ninguna pudo terminar sus estudios, por lo que se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. Situación que no quieren para sus hijos por eso luchan, para brindarles mejores oportunidades.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que la coordinadora del banco comunal Bello amanecer es Juana Guillermina y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en pequeñas cantidades como sobre de shampoo, sobre de café, pan, huevos, frijoles, azúcar, leche, arroz, aceite, tiste. Actividad que la desempeña con muchos gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. La rutina de trabaja de Juana es trabajar unas 12 horas ofreciendo su productos en su pulpería. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de consumo diario para el hogar. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Bello Amanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Bello Amanecer communal bank is made up of nine members; eight women and one gentleman, mothers and fathers with a total of 20 children in their care.  They are originally from Sucre, a place located in the northern part of the country; a place known for being a milk, cottage cheese, and cheese producer.  These people are responsible, hardworking, and have a desire succeed.

Unfortunately none of them were able to finish school because the needed to go to work from young ages.  They don't want their children to suffer the same fate, so they work to provide them better opportunities.

Thanks to their spirit and desire to get ahead, the bank's coordinator, Juana Guillermina she has a general store in her home.  It' a small store where she sells small quantities of items such as shampoo, coffee, bread, eggs, beans, sugar, milk, rice, cooking oil, etc.  She does this with great pleasure and it has become a way of life for her family.  Juana's routine is to work 12 hours a day, offering her products in her store.  Her goal is to invest in stocking her store and buy daily consumables for the home.  She wants to have a better income in the not too distant future.  The Bello Amanecer communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua by providing them with a means for dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Elsa tiene 29 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos y se dedica a comercializar frito de cerdo con tortillas, atol, tamales esa actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de cerdo, maíz, leña, cal, hoja de chagüites etc. Martha vende platanitos y Teresa vende leña y tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of these is Ella. She is 29 years old, in a live-in relationship, with two children. She makes a living selling fried pork with tortillas, atol, and tamales. She has been performing this activity for four years. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pork, corn, firewood, lime, banana leaves, etc. Martha sells fried plantains and Teresa sells firewood and has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of primary materials, pork, corn, firewood, lime, and banana leaves.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Angela quien tiene una  pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 6 años. Inicia su pulpería anteriormente vendía frijoles cocidos, hielo, bolis y gaseosa, durante un tiempo con sus pocas ganancias fue ahorrando, y fue comprando productos menores de pulpería hasta que logro funcionar su nuevo negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, productos del mor, medicamentos populares, carne de pollo, carne de res etc. María Teresa tiene 28 años y vende platanitos y enchiladas y Carlos tiene 42 años de edad se dedica a comercializar venta de calzados.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Angela, who has had a grocery store in her home for 6 years.  When she started her grocery store, she had previously sold cooked beans, pens, and soda water for a time.  With her earnings saving up, she bought minor products for her store until her new store was able to function.  

The loan will be invested in buying basic grains like rice and beans as well as sugar, oil, dairy products, popular medications, chicken and beef.  

María Teresa is 28 years old and sells bananas and enchiladas and Carlos is 42 years old and works in selling footwear.

loans.use: buy basic products like rice, beans, sugar, beef, chicken, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Los Zensontles Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras Perla tiene 43 años de edad, casada con un hijo y se dedica a vender cosméticos desde hace 6 años. Los cosméticos son de la Avon quienes los vende al crédito y al contado a vecinos, amigos de la comunidad lo que le a permitido sacar a su familia adelante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como crema para cuerpo, crema
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. Perla is 43 years old and married, with a son. She has made a living selling cosmetics for six years. The cosmetics are from Avon. She sells them on credit and in cash to neighbors and friends of the community, which has allowed her and her family to come out ahead. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics like body creams and creams.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Avon cosmetics like body creams, face creams, colognes, perfumes, women's lotions, etc.

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
This is Menardo. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Menardo dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes that his children will have a better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.id: Eduarda is married she has a kiosk to generate income for her family.She has been thinking how to run a big  business  she is applying for a loan of $1000.00 to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as Coca-cola,fanta,sprite,noodles,bread,cigarettes,eggs.Her husband is a driver. she opened her kiosk one year ago with her own capital of $200.00.

loans.use: To buy Cocacola,fanta,sprite,noodle,bread

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 34 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is married with two children who are aged six and 10 years old.

Leonard's transport business is doing well after the loan and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy iron sheets to use in renovating the rental houses. He is optimistic that his business will do better after this loan.


He hopes to improve his family's living standard in the near future.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets.

loans.name: Mauda

texts.en: Mauda is a widow from Lubiri Mbarara municipality who lost her husband 8 years ago after a long sickness acquired from the bush war that brought the current government to power. After the death of her husband, life became miserable since he was the family's only bread winner. The situation worsened when her in-laws took all the properties she was left with. Later she managed to raise some capital from her friends and started a small retail shop business. This is the same business that feeds her children, pays their school tuitions, as well as meets all the basic needs of the home. She wants to buy more items for selling; this will increase her income and she will be able to pay tuition for her son from the profits. She is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy stock items to sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: La señora Leonor tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera, su hija e hijo que tiene se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, ellos tienen becas de estudios y alimentación, por eso disminuyen gastos de estudios. El domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad Tapera a 45 Km. de nuestra ciudad. Ella produce y vende maíz, maní, también trabaja de portera en la unidad educativa de su comunidad, los ingresos que obtiene son, para cubrir gastos en ropa y otros que tienen sus hijos en la Universidad, Está solicitando crédito para compra de material escolar y tener más para poder venderlos a los estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad, además será para la compra de herbicidas para el fumigado de maíz y maní que tiene. El mayor deseo de Leonor es mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de sus 2 hijos que tiene y así  puedan salir profesionales para  tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Leonor, 47, is single and her son and daughter are students at the university.  They have scholarships for their studies and food, so their expenses are lower.  Their home is in the Tapera community, which is 45 kilometers from our city.  Leonor grows corn and peanuts, and also works as concierge at the community school.  Her income is used to cover clothing and other expenses for her children at the university.

She is requesting a loan to buy school materials to sell to students who attend the community school.  She also will buy herbicides for her corn and peanut crops.  Leonor's biggest desire is to improve her income to cover her children's expenses so they can become professionals and lead a better life.

loans.use: To buy school materials.

loans.name: Mario Rodrigo

texts.es:
Mario es una persona muy joven desde muy pequeño  empezó a trabajar en la agricultura juntamente con sus padres donde fue aprendiendo a cultivar papa, zanahoria, cebolla durante  en el tiempo que creció.
Mario vive en la  comunidad muy alejado del pueblo más o menos se encuentra a 30 kilómetros de mizque del departamento de Cochabamba, Mario con  24 años de edad vivió en el campo  desde muy pequeño por la pobreza empezó a trabajar en la agricultura como jornalero. Esta época por el desastre natural de la helada  su pequeña parcela de papa no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que él esperaba. Por la distancia y lejanía  de su comunidad del pueblo vino a vivir a la provincia y buscar una mejor vida para toda su familia en el lugar donde vive solo cosechan una sola vez al año, no cuentan con riego en la zona y tienen que esperar la época de aguacero para sembrar sus productos. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con el  crédito que está solicitando el desea trabajar independientemente y para comenzar necesita comprar  abono orgánico y semillas para  de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is a young man who began working in agriculture when he was a small boy.  Alongside his father, he learned to grow potatoes, carrots, and onions in the time it took for him to become an adult.

Mario lives in a community far from the village, about 30 kilometers from Mizque in the department of Cochabamba.  He is 24 years old and has always lived in the country.  Because of his situation of poverty he started working in agriculture as a wage earner when he was a boy.  During that time his small patch of land suffered an ice storm and the potatoes did not grow well.  This disaster meant he was unable to earn the income he had expected.  Because of how far away his community was from the village, he went to live in the province to seek out a better lifestyle for his family.  Where he lives now they only plant once a year, as they have no irrigation in the area so they have to wait until the rainy season to plant their crops.

By working hard and requesting the loan, he hopes to work independently.  To begin, he needs to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.  This will help him improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio, tiene 30 años de edad es bachiller, soltero sin hijos trabaja como agricultor y como comerciante de ropa, vendiendo cinco días de cada semana trasladando su mercadería de pueblo en pueblo en su humilde vehículo, como agricultor tiene plantaciones de naranja, mandarina y yuca en su propio terreno agrícola ubicado en sindicato siglo xx, se dedica a la agricultura los otros dos días restantes de la semana aprovecha para mantener y cosechar sus naranjas , mandarina y yuca siempre trabaja solo y no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie para mantener sus plantaciones y cuando estén listos para su comercialización los comercializa siempre en la zona local, el sr. Eusebio desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos para ello necesita la ayuda de este crédito, porque quiere ampliar sus cítricos (naranja y mandarina) para mejorar el nivel de vida que tiene mejorando también su producción y calidad de sus cítricos para así poder quizás formar una familia.
texts.en:
Eusebio, 30, is a high school graduate, single and has no children.  He works as a farmer and also sells clothing.  Five days a week he goes from village to village in his modest vehicle to sell his merchandise.  As a farmer he grows oranges, tangerines and yucca plant on his own farmland which is in the "Siglo XX" trade union area.  On weekends, he takes care of his crops and always works alone, with no one to help maintain the plantations.  When the crops are ready for harvest he sells them in the local area.

Eusebio wants to improve his income and is requesting a loan.  He plans to expand his citrus crop (oranges and tangerines) to improve his lifestyle.  He also wants to improve citrus production and quality, so he can form a family one day.

loans.use: To buy supplies to increase citrus production.

loans.name: Alas De Cofradia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxito una de ella es Esther tiene 21 años de edad, casada y se dedica a vender cosméticos y ropas variada desde hace 5 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como cremas para cuerpos, crema para manos, crema facial, perfumen de dama, perfume de varón etc. 

Los otro dos del grupo: Dora tiene 32 años de edad y vende ropa nueva y variada y Félix vende leche de vaca ambulante con carretón de caballos.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three successful entrepreneurs. Esther is one of them: she is 21 years old, she is married and she has been engaging in selling cosmetics and different kinds of clothes for 5 years already. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy Avon cosmetics such as body lotions, hand lotions, face lotions, women's perfumes, men's perfumes and other products. 


The other two members of the group:  Dora is 32 years old and she sells different kinds of new clothes, and Félix is a street vendor selling cow milk that he transports with a horse-driven cart.

loans.use: To buy body lotions, hand lotions, face lotions, women's perfumes, men's perfumes among other products.

loans.name: La Estrella Azul Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores con éxito una de ella es Marcela de 30 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos y tiene 6 años de vender ropa usada, inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa nueva, ese producto le generaba pocos ingresos que se aventuró a comercializar ropa usada a los departamentos del país, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa usada.  

Los otros dos miembros del grupo:  Marina vende gaseosa y William vende pollo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three successful entrepreneurs. Marcela is one of them: she is 30 years old, she is married and she has three children. She has been selling used clothes for 6 years; at first she was selling new clothes, but since she was not earning enough by selling this product, she decided to take a chance and started selling used clothes to the various department stores of the country. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stocks of used clothes.
 

The other two members of the group:  Marina sells fizzy drinks and William sells chicken.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es: José Inés es un microempresario de éxito que tiene su taller de carpintería desde hace 10 años, tiene 35 años de edad, soltero y con cuatro hijos menores, inicia su negocio fabricando pocos muebles como camas matrimoniales  por falta de capital, poco a poco con sus utilidades se fue capitalizando comprando materia prima como la madera lo que fue haciendo muebles en escalas y comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados del país, actualmente cuenta con dos trabajadores. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como pega, madera cedro real, clavos de dos pulgadas, selladores, lijas, bisagra, tornillos, caladoras etc.
texts.en:
José Inés is a succesful small business owner who has been running a carpentry shop for ten years.  He is 35, single and has four minor children.  He started his business with a small amount of capital making only a few pieces of furniture such as double beds.  Little by little, he earned more money and began buying wood to make more furniture and sell it in different markets throughout the country.  He now employs two people.

He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials such as glue, cedar wood, two-inch nails, sealants, sandpaper, hinges, screws, etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as glue, cedar wood, two-inch nails, sealants, sandpaper, hinges, screws, etc.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita es una microempresaria de éxito de 21 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, ella se dedica a comercializar venta de gaseosas y servicios de alquiler de nintendo, desde hace un año, el crédito lo solicita para adquirir nuevos juegos de nintendo, y compra de gaseosa de bigcola etc.
texts.en: Sarita is a successful microentrepreneur aged 21. She is married and she has a young child. She has been engaging in selling fizzy drinks and in renting out Nintendo consoles for about a year. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new Nintendo videogames and to buy fizzy drinks such as Bigcola and other brands.

loans.use: To buy Nintendo videogames and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una microempresaria y agricultora originaria de Masaya, ella se dedica a la comercialización de venta de verduras frescas, frutas frescas desde hace 10 años, tiene 63 años de edad, con 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, como actividad segunda se dedica a la siembra de maíz de riegos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como zanahoria, cebolla dulce, ayote, chayote, yucas, tomate, chiltoma, plátano, insumos agrícolas para la siembra como fertilizantes, abono, semilla mejorada, urea, pago de mozos, preparación de la tierra, etc.
texts.en:
Francisca is a small business owner and a farmer from Masaya. She has sold fresh fruits and vegetables for 10 years. She is 63 and has 6 grown children. As her secondary activity, she plants corn that she irrigates. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of vegetables such as carrots, sweet onions, squash, chayote, yucca, tomatoes, bell peppers, and plantains. She will also invest in agricultural supplies for planting such as fertilizers, improved seeds, urea [fertilizer], payment for hired hands, preparation of the land, etc.

loans.use: purchase vegetables to sell as well as agricultural supplies for planting her fields

loans.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Gerardo es un microempresario de éxito y además es agricultor durante toda su vida herencia de sus padres, el cultiva maíz y el mismo lo comercializa en los mercados del país, tiene 13 años que la institución le brinda financiamiento para su agricultura, es un emprendedor casado y tiene 58 años de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes como abono, urea, alquiler de terreno, granos para la siembra, desgranado, sacos etc.
texts.en: On top of being a successful micro entrepreneur, Gerardo has been a farmer all of his life, an activity he has inherited from his parents. He plants corn and sells it in the various markets of the country. Gerardo is 58 years old and he is a married man. Our institution has been granting him loans for his agriculture activity for 13 years. This new loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and urea, seeds to plant, corn off the cob, sacks and to pay rent for his lands.

loans.use: To buy manure and urea, seeds to plant, corn off the cob, sacks and to pay rent for his lands.

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es:
El Joven Carlos tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus Padre, no tiene dependientes, su horario de trabajo es de HRS. 7:00 am a 12:00 pm y HRAS. 14:00 a 21:00 de la noche por lo tanto es un trabajo muy agotador para él.                                                                                                         
Actualmente Carlos trabaja en su pequeña imprenta con su papá quien le colabora en la elaboración de empastados, sellos y otros, el diario vivir del joven Carlos es muy sacrificado ya que las actividades de la imprenta es de tener mucho cuidado.  Los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y otros de su persona y para apoyar a su familia, por ese motivo el tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito, para poder comprar materia prima de su imprenta y así poder realizar los pedidos que le solicitan. Con esta inversión él quiere mejorar sus ingresos económicos que le permita mejorar su condición de vida de Carlos y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old. He lives in his parents' house and does not have any dependents. His work schedule is from 7am to 12pm and 2pm to 9pm, so it is very exhausting work for him.

Carlos currently works in his small printing business along with his father, who helps him make bindings and stamps, among other products. His daily life is very demanding, because he has to be very careful with the printing. 

His earnings are not enough to cover the costs of food, clothing and other personal costs while supporting his family. Therefore, he decided to apply for a loan to buy supplies for printing and to fulfill his customers' orders. With this investment, he wants to improve his financial income, which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for printing.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has four children and has been doing this work for six years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'feeding my animals!' Her biggest challenge is 'Dairy feeds.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Karoi.'

Beatrice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They have good training programs.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Beatrice replied, 'I will get milk to feed my family." She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Beatrice owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity, 25, is a business lady from Kwacha section in Kabompo district, North Western Province, Zambia. She is married with no children. She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a stove for her restaurant. 

Purity said that she was operating a restaurant with the challenge of not having some equipment, such as a proper stove.

“I have some challenges in doing my business because I do not have equipments like the stove because the one I have is small,” Purity said.

She said that she got motivated through a friend who told her about Rent to Own. 

“When I get a big stove, I think it will be quicker even when preparing food I will be doing it on time,” Purity said. 

Purity mentioned that she is living in a small community and that it is not well developed. She has been thinking about growing her business over the past year, but up until now has not been able to secure a new stove.

“With the things that I have as at now, I can at least make about ZMW 300 per day but I think when I get an equipment, I will be getting more than that because I will be preparing more food than what I can mange now,” Purity said.

It is for this reason Purity is appealing to the Kiva lenders to help her with the loan so that she can buy a stove as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy a new stove for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells the staple Ghanaian food, yams, in the markets in and around Elmina. Esi has been selling  yams for 5 years now. She is married and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband feed and clothe their children.  Esi  will use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of yams to sell in the market.  Esi  will expand her business sales with the new profit from her influx of capital. She is excited to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of yams to sell in the market.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria sells materials and plates at Soba, a community in Hohoe. Gloria has received education to the middle school level. She is married and has one child with her husband, who works at a saw mill. Gloria has been selling materials and plates for the past 12 years to support herself and her husband. She is also responsible for her parents. 

Her loan will be used to buy more cloth to expand her cloth business, which was the main reason why she joined her loan group. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more plates to expand her working capital and enable her to sell an increased variety of plates.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to expand her cloth business.

loans.name: Rosa Amparo

texts.es:
“Cuando las cosas se hacen con amor, el fracaso no existe”. Con esta frase Rosa de 54 años, manifiesta el porqué se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Aunque toda su vida ha sido una mujer de provincia, nunca se imaginó que la agricultura se convertiría en su actividad económica y la generadora del sustento para su hogar. Su familia siempre ha trabajado sembrando la tierra, razón que la motivó a emprender el mismo camino. 
Desde hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo de cebolla y papa, en los cuales labora diariamente, alternando su actividad con las tareas del hogar. 
Sus dos hijos son su más grande tesoro y su mayor aliciente para trabajar cada día; desea brindarles la oportunidad de viajar a la ciudad para que realicen sus estudios universitarios y accedan a mejores condiciones de vida.
Para lograr los sueños que se albergan en su corazón, Rosa se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de semillas, abonos y químicos para extender sus sembrados y sacar una cosecha de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
"When you make things with love, there is no such thing as failure." With this sentence, Rosa, 54, expresses why she works in agriculture. Although she has always lived in the countryside, she never thought that agriculture would become her economic activity and the source of income for her family. Her family has always worked in agriculture, which is why she took the same path.

Rosa has been growing onions and potatoes for ten years, working every day and alternating this activity with the household chores.

Her two children are her biggest treasure and motivation to work each day; she wants to provide them with the opportunity to travel to the city and study at the university in order to find better opportunities in life.

In order to fulfill the dreams at the bottom of her heart, Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in buying seeds, compost and chemicals needed to expand her crops and harvest better-quality produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor vive en Curicó y vende pan centeno y queque. Hace más de 4 años que tiene su negocio y además vende jabones naturales que compra a una persona de Santiago que hace los productos la misma persona. Vende en Santiago y Curicó a pedido en empresas. Ocupara su préstamo para comprar de jabones y guardo un poco de capital para comprar insumos y hacer pan y queque. En el futuro ella le gustaría Establecer su negocio y poder ella misma hacer el pan y queque, pero para ellos necesita tener maquinas especiales y un local. Es mama soltera y tiene dos hijos, de 22 y 25 y están en la Universidad, estudian Medicina y Kinesiología. Le ha gustado trabajar con fondo esperanza porque le hace sentir El hacerla bien y apoyada y por la guía constante que tiene.
texts.en:
Flor lives in Curicó and sells rye bread and cake. She has had her business for four years and also sells natural soaps that she buys from a person in Santiago who makes the products. She sells by order to businesses in Santiago and Curicó. She will use her loan to buy soaps and keep some of the capital to buy bread and cake. 

In the future she would like to establish her business and be able to make the breads and cakes herself but to do so she needs special machines and a business space. She is a single mother and has two children who are 22 and 25 years old, studying Medicine and Kinesiology. She has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza because it makes her feel good and well supported, in addition to the constant guidance that she receives.

loans.use: to buy soaps and to save a portion of the working capital to buy breads and cakes.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel se dedica a prestar sus servicios como Docente guía y al mismo tiempo dicta la materia de Ingeniería Química hace más de dos años, por otro lado tiene un vehículo que lo utiliza para alquilarlo a cualquier persona, por ello le urge seguir trabajando con su movilidad ya que por ahora está en reparación la parte del motor, para ello necesita el crédito que solicita para poder refaccionar el motor de su vehículo, de esa manera podrá percibir sus ingresos, además quiere ahorrar para poder comprar un lote para que pueda vivir junto a su familia más cómodamente ya que ahora no tiene un espacio muy amplio para que puedan estar más cómodos, especialmente su madre quien necesita un espacio amplio para poder seguir desarrollando su actividad que es la Elaboración de Masitas. El Sr. Miguel es soltero y aun no tiene hijos solo vive junto a su madre en la casa de sus tías.
texts.en: Miguel works offering his services as a teacher and guide, and he has also taught chemical engineering for over two years. He also has a car that he rents out to people. It is very important for him to continue working in transport, and at the moment, his car is undergoing repairs. He needs the loan he is applying for to repair his car's motor. This way, he will receive his income. He also wants to save so that he can buy a lot in order to live more comfortably together with his family. Currently, they don't have a very large space where they can be more comfortable, in particular his mother, who needs more space for her work, which is pastry-making. Miguel is single and does not have children. He lives together with his mother in his aunts' house.

loans.use: to repair a motor

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: WILBER es de estado civil casado, no tiene hijos bajo su dependencia, el  y su esposa  quieren establecerse económicamente para luego darles comodidad a los hijos que fueran a tener y agrandar su familia, según referencias son responsables y muy trabajadores;  la actividad a la que se dedica es al servicio de internet en una tienda, dónde también cuenta con cabinas telefónicas,  actualmente está pasando por una mala situación económica, ya que los equipos sufrieron un corte que afectó a las computadoras, y ahora el solicitante requiere este crédito para poder obtener más capital comprando tarjetas de telefonía, y luego juntar dinero para que pueda hacer arreglar sus equipos de computación y así mejorar, sus ingresos, y evitar cualquier inconveniente económico.
texts.en: Wilber is married without children under his responsibility. He and his wife want to be financially stable so they will be able to accommodate their future children and expand their family. As per references, they are responsible and hard working. He runs an Internet service in a store where he also offers phone service. He is currently going through hard financial times as his equipment suffered an electrical surge that affected all of the computers. He is requesting the loan to buy phone cards and to put money together to repair his computers and equipment in order to improve his earnings and prevent any more economic inconveniences.

loans.use: buy phone cards for his business.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El Sr. Jhonny tiene 27 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero pero convive con Lucía (en la foto el Sr. Jhonny y su esposa Lucía), tienen dos hijos bajo su dependencia, actualmente se dedica al servicio de taxi trabajando por los alrededores de la ciudad, por esto él no puede ni siquiera ir al medio día a compartir un almuerzo con su familia.   Él quiere ingresar a una línea de taxis, para tener más seguridad en cuanto a los delincuentes, ya que  es bastante peligroso por los lugares en que trabaja, pues así tendrá mejor control y mayores ingresos, ya que la gente que sube a su automóvil se sentirá más segura de que es una línea conocida y así no corren el riesgo de sufrir robos u otros inconvenientes, además que por pertenecer a  estos sindicatos les dan otro tipo de beneficios a los conductores; esas son las razones por la que solicita este crédito y de esta manera pueda aminorar riesgos y mejorar su estatus de vida.
texts.en:
Jhonny is twenty-seven years old and is legally single, although he lives with Lucía (Jhonny and his partner Lucía are pictured in the photo).  They have two children in their care.  He is presently making a living by offering a taxi service in the areas surrounding the city; it is for this reason that he cannot return home at midday to share the lunch meal with his family.

He wants to join an official taxi company in order to have more security in regard to offenders; it is very dangerous in the areas where he works.  In joining, he will have better control and greater income; the people who get into his automobile will feel more safe being in a recognized taxi, thereby not running the risk of suffering robbery or other inconveniences.  Additionally, these companies give other types of benefits to their drivers.

These are the reasons that he is requesting this loan, and in doing this, he will be able to reduce his risks and improve his life status.

loans.use: to become part of an official taxi service company.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos, tiene 38 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por tres miembros él y los dos padres, es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, viven en la comunidad de Kurumayu del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce cebolla, frejol y papa; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Don Carlos es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de su familia. Tienen una vivienda de paredes de adobe, techo de cañahueca y revoque de barro, esta clase de vivienda cada año antes de las lluvias hay que hacer el revoque, Don Carlos, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, con esto el podrá generar mejores ingresos y en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia y así poder reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old.  His family is comprised of three members:  himself and his two parents.  It is a modest family of scarce economic resources.  They live in the community of Kurumayu in the municipality of Mizque, in the department of Cochabamba.

He works in agriculture and animal husbandry, and produces onions, beans and potatoes.  He sells them in the same place he lives to vendors who are also from Mizque. 

Carlos is a very respected person in his community, for his dedication to his work and for being responsible for feeding and educating his family.  They have a house with adobe walls, and wattle and daub roof.  With this type of housing, the roof plastering much be done every year before the rains.

Carlos is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and agrochemicals, and with the profit he makes in the future he will improve living conditions for his whole family, and thus be able to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: La señora  Cirila tiene 56 años de edad,   tiene 4 hijas Carla, Ana, Ligia y Andrea  las cuales  son dependientes de ella, la sra. Cirila da todo por sus hijas ellas estudian en colegio. La sra. Cirila  vive en la provincia Cercado de Cochabamba en la zona central, perseverante con sus metas, Hizo estudiar a sus  hijas logrando sacarles adelante algunas cursando diferentes carreras en  la Universidad Mayor de San Simón, todo eso logro gracias a la producción de leche que ella se dedica, cuenta con 10 vacas lecheras de las cuales 7 están en producción 1 se encuentra preñada y 2 se encuentran en descanso . Su esposo Alberto se fue a Santa Cruz  del cual no sabe nada por que les abandono hace 1 año, el motivo del presente crédito para la compra de alimento, ''cascara de soya'' ya que necesita para almacenar ya que se le presento una oportunidad de compra.La sra. Cirila está muy contenta de poder solicitar este nuevo crédito ya que con el anterior solicitado, ella pudo incrementar una Vaca lechera y reponer su ganado.
texts.en:
Cirila, age 56, has four daughters, Carla, Ana, Ligia, and Andrea.  The daughters are dependent upon her.  Cirila gives everything for her daughters to go to school.  Cirila lives in the Cercado province in the central area of Cochabamba.

She is diligent about her goals, and she made her daughters go to school.  She managed to get them ahead, and some of them are studying different careers at the Mayor de San Simón University.  She achieved all of this thanks to her business, milk production.  She has ten dairy cows.  Seven of them are now producing milk, one is pregnant, and two are in a resting period.

Her husband, Alberto, went to Santa Cruz.  She knows nothing about him because he abandoned her one year ago.

The reason for the current loan is to buy soybean husks to feed the cows.  She needs to store it because a purchasing opportunity presented itself to her.

Cirila is very happy to be able to request this new loan.  With the previous loan that she requested she was able to get another dairy cow and to restock her cattle.

loans.use: to buy soy husks to feed her cows.

loans.name: José Johnny

texts.es: El señor José Johnny con 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, con una instrucción de nivel primario, económicamente muy independiente de sus padres, vive en Colomi zona norte sobre carretera Cbba-Santa Cruz. El Joven José Johnny cuenta con un taller eléctrico en el mismo domicilio con atención diario ya que más antes trabajaba junto a su hermano desde muy pequeño por lo que ahora hace un año tiene su taller propio y necesita herramientas de trabajo, por este motivo él solicita este crédito para comprar un cargador de baterías más una gata caimán, con esta oportunidad , ahora se siente muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y que a futuro mejorara sus ingresos, aparte tiene un sueño de tener una casa propia que actualmente trabaja en casa alquilada y está pagando mucho.
texts.en:
Jose Johnny is 20 years old, single, and has completed primary school instruction. He is quite independent of his parents and lives in Colomi's northern zone along the Cbba-Santa Cruz highway. 

The young Jose Johnny has an electrical repair shop in his house which he attends to each day. Previously, from an early age, he worked with his brother but now, for the past year, he has had his own shop, and for that reason he needs to buy work tools.

That's why Jose Johnny is requesting this loan, to purchase a battery charger and a hydraulic jack. Now, with this opportunity, he feels very happy to be able to obtain a loan that will improve his income in the future. Jose Johnny also dreams of having his own house since at present, he works in a rented house for which he is paying a large amount.

loans.use: buy tools for his work as an electrician.

loans.name: Edson Ronald

texts.es: Edson es una persona muy sencilla y trabajadora él tiene 22 años de edad, no es casado ni tiene hijos pero si ayuda mucho a sus padres que por la edad no pueden seguir trabajando en la actividad de la agricultura además Edson  solo estudio hasta el nivel primario y no pudo seguir con sus estudios por problemas personales y económicos, así  de esta manera tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura, Edson siembra papa, y tiene plantaciones de frutilla en los terrenos de sus padres, desde hace ya más de 7 años que se está dedicando a esta actividad, él nos cuenta que le va bien en el mercado pero quiere incrementar su producción ya que la actual es muy poca y solo le alcanza para el vivir diario, es por tal motivo que él solicita este nuevo crédito ya que él quiere incrementar su plantación de frutilla y así con el futuro poder ahorrar para comprarse sus propias tierras y dedicarse a la cría de ganado vacuno para así mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a sus padres. Com el anterior crédito el pudo comprara insumos para la producción de frutilla, por eso, el nuevamente solicita éste con el mismo destino.
texts.en: Edson is a simple and hardworking person.  He’s 22 years old, not married, has no children, but he helps his parents very much with their farming.  Edson only completed elementary school and was not able to go any farther because of personal and financial issues, so he had to become a farmer.  Edson raises potatoes, has a plantation on his parents’ land, and has done this for more than 7 years.  He says that the market is good and that he wants to increase his production because the current one is very low and is just enough for his daily expenses.  He is asking for this loan so he can increase his strawberry production so that he can save up to buy his own land and raise cattle.  This will allow him to improve his quality of life and continue supporting his parents.  He used the money from the previous loan to buy supplies for strawberry production.  He will use this loan for the same thing.

loans.use: to buy strawberry seedlings.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro se dedica a su actividad de Agricultura hace más de 20 años, es casado y tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 de ellos dependen de su ingreso, solicita el crédito para la compra de semilla de ajo aprovechando que es la época de siembra. El Sr. Pedro nos señaló que quiere aumentar su producción de papa este año para lo cual necesita tener una producción de ajo para obtener buena utilidad, por lo que presenta esta solicitud de crédito, de esa manera mejorara su estatus de vida y además podrá seguir construyendo su casita que lo necesita para que sus hijos tengan un mayor espacio para poder realizar sus tareas, además quiere ahorrar para poder comprar un Vehículo para que pueda traer sus productos a la ciudad y no realizar un costo en el traslado de los mismos, lo cual será de mucha utilidad para el cliente.
texts.en:
Pedro has been a farmer for over twenty years. He is married with eight children. Only two of them still depend on his income. 

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase garlic seeds, because it is sowing season. Pedro tells us he wants to increase his production of potatoes this year, so he needs to have a good garlic harvest in order to obtain a good profit. For this reason he is submitting a loan application, so that he may improve his living standards. He will also be able to continue building his little house, which he needs in order for his children to have more space to do their work.

He also wants to save up for a vehicle so that he can bring his products to the city and not have to pay for transporting them, which will be very useful to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase garlic seed.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es: El señor Aniceto tiene 63 años de edad, vive con su esposa Salome, tienen un hijo que depende de ellos y que trabaja en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, el domicilio está ubicado en Cantón Fernández de la comunidad el Puente a 40 Km. de la ciudad de Monteagudo. Ellos se dedican a la producción y venta de maíz blando, como también crían y venden cerdos criollos, obtienen ingresos de ambas actividades para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, ropa y otros que tienen ellos. Están solicitando crédito para compra de semilla de maíz hibrida, agroquímicos, pago mano de obra de personal eventual en la siembra y fumigado, para así obtener ingresos, por otra para alimento de sus animales como de ellos. El mayor deseo de Aniceto es mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su hijo para que él pueda tener su propio taller de costura y no trabajar de empleado.
texts.en: Aniceto, 63, lives with his wife Salome. They have a son who is dependent on them and works in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Their home is in Fernández Canton, in the community of El Puente, about 40 kilometers from Monteagudo. They work growing and selling corn. They also raise and sell pigs. They earn income from both these activities to cover their expenses for food and clothing, among other things. They are asking for a loan to buy hybrid corn seeds and agrochemicals, and to pay workers to plant and fumigate. This way they will earn money and be able to feed their animals as well as themselves. Aniceto's greatest wish is to increase his income so that he can help his son have his own sewing shop instead of being an employee.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and agrochemicals, and to pay for fumigation and planting.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité El Progreso está situado en la colonia Araujokue, de la ciudad de Curuguaty,  cuenta con 10 integrantes todas cuentan con actividades productivas, Formaron el comité con el compromiso de trabajar en  conjunto y ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no tuvieron. La Señora Mariana es una de las integrantes del comité tiene con una despensa y quería ampliar su despensa y decidió formar para su comité, accedió al crédito y empezaron a trabajar. Ella también se está dedicando en la venta de producto de limpieza  mediante la fundación que le brinda capacitación y le provee los productos a precio más bajo para poder obtener más ganancia, gracias a las microfranquicias que le ofrece.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Kits de limpieza, el cual es una de las microfranquicias, y también para la compra de insumos para su despensa con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The El Progreso (Progress) communal bank is located in the Araujokue colony, in the city of Curuguaty.  It has 10 members, all of whom have productive jobs.  They formed the communal bank with the promise of working together and helping each other to be able to give their families all that they didn't have.

Señora Mariana is one of the communal bank members.  She has a small grocery store and wanted to expand it so she joined the communal bank, accepted credit, and began to work.  She also makes a living selling cleaning products at the foundation where she gets her training, and she offers them at a lower price in order to get more profit, thanks to the micro-franchising they offer.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy cleaning kits, which are one of the micro-franchises, and also to buy supplies for her small store so that she can continue working and fulfilling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy kits and supplies for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for four years. She generates additional income through animal keeping.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She sells her products at retail, and she is at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to build her own house. The family resides in a rented house, with no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Isidro pasa al sexto ciclo en forma excelente, el grupo demuestra muchas ganas de crecer dentro del programa, demostrando solidaridad y unión.  Todas ellas son muy trabajadoras y tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Silvina, quien por medio de su ejemplo trata de mostrar a sus compañeras que si se puede. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, y con ello y sus ingresos ayuda a su familia dándoles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Ella se define a si misma como una persona que desea salir adelante y crecer.
Silvina solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, productos a granel y demás insumos que son los que más salida tienen para poder seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
The group San Isidro enters its sixth cycle in great shape; the group demonstrates a lot of desire to grow within the program, showing solidarity and unity.  All of the women are hardworking and have a lot of will to continue moving forward and to help their families. 

One of the women is Silvina.  Through example, she tries to show her group members that they can do it.  She has a small, well-stocked store in her home; through this and her income, she helps her family in giving them everything they need for a life without deprivation.  She defines herself as a person that wishes to get ahead and grow.

Silvina requests this loan in order to invest in the purchase of drinks, dairy products, canned products, bulk items, and other goods that are in high demand, so that she can continue giving her clients a good variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, canned products, bulk items, and other goods.

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Déborah, membre du groupe d’affaire Maombi est entrepreneur, âgée de 47ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant, mère de 10 enfants  tous scolarisés et vendeuse de farine de manioc. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  11 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit va  lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 10sacs de 50 kilos de farine de manioc qu'elle va marchander. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un dépôt de stockage pour une bonne survie de sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son assistance en crédit aux femmes pauvres économiquement active.
texts.en:
Déborah is a member of the Maombi Group. She is an entrepreneur, and 47 years of age. Déborah is married to a teacher, and is the mother of ten children, all of whom attend school. Déborah is a cassava flour merchant and has just completed her 11th loan cycle with Hekima.

Déborah's new loan will serve to supply her with ten 50-kilo sacks of cassava flour, for which she will haggle. Déborah's ambition is to open a storage depot so that she can ensure a good life for her family. She thanks Hekima for their loan assistance to poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: to purchase ten 50-kilo sacks of cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Natacha Therese's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son cycle premier et elles y sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Le responsable madame madeleine est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles 3 garçons dont le plus âgé a 25 ans. Elle est debout à gauche  de la photo  habillée en tissus wax beige.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de boissons depuis bientôt dix ans et dispose d'une bonne éxpérience,son nouveau crédit de 100000 francs cfa lui permettra de se procurer des caisses de boissons sucrées et de jus de fruits qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son magasin situé au niveau de son domicile dans le but de renforcer son commerce.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This group of women joined the local "banc villageois" association since its first loan cycle and they are united by good social and professional relationships.

The leader, Madame Madeleine, is a married woman aged 53 and a mother of five children: two girls and three boys, the eldest of whom is 25. She is standing on the left of the picture dressed in beige wax fabric.

She has been active in the soft drinks business for nearly ten years and has acquired a solid experience.  Her new 100,000 FCFA loan will enable her to strengthen her business by purchasing crates of soft drinks and fruit juices that she will then sell retail from her home-based shop.

Profits will enable her to support her children's food, health and educational needs.

loans.use: buy crates of drinks for a small business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has 3 children whose age ranges from 3 to 21 years old. She describes herself to be a leader and a humble woman . She operates a restaurant  where she sells tea, snacks and food. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a high potential business area and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of food ingredients . She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy food ingredient for preparing meals to sell. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has 4 children aged 14, 10, 7, 5. In 2010, Mohamed established his computer and accessories business. He began his business because he wanted to become self-reliant after graduating from a computer school. His business is located on the outskirts and his main customers are young boys, girls and adults. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,602,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He has paid back 3 loans. Mohamed requires a loan in order to expand his business into an internet cafe. He hopes that this loan will help to improve the new business by increasing the stocks. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand and to move to a shop. He thanks Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has three children ages seven, nine, and twelve. All are school-going children. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to be fostered.  

In 2010, Ibrahim established his business selling school bags, travelling bags, travelling boxes, hangers, and similar products. He began his business after he dropped out of school because of the death of his father. As he lacked financial support, he joined his elder sister in her business. His friend later supplied him with some stock to be sold. The commission he received was used to start his own business.

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,050,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy school bags, travelling bags and travelling boxes. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to open a shop, build a house and educate his children and younger brothers.  This loan will help him to achieve some of his future plans. Shortage of stock from suppliers is his major challenge. He is a hardworking and committed businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more suitcases

loans.name: Noonkokua

texts.en:
Noonkokua has repaid her previous loan due to the good harvest she received. She has used the proceeds to lease an additional piece of land for maize and beans farming.

She has been advanced 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) by KADET LTD, which will facilitate the preparation of the enlarged area of cultivation as well as purchase of inputs like fertilizers and seedlings.

She hopes to use the increased proceeds to diversify into sheep rearing. Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dignabana2 Group

texts.fr:
Groupe de solidarité, l’Association DIGNABANA 2  est localisée dans la région centrale du Togo et a pour responsable  Koudjoukalo. 

Elle est revendeuse de boisson locale et est mariée à un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 05 enfants tous scolarisés. Koudjoukalo est âgée de 40 ans. Son activité est basée en RÉGION CENTRALE. Elle est dans ce domaine depuis 2000 et se fait aider par 01 personne. Elle souhaite avec ses revenus assurer le bien être et une meilleure scolarisation à ses enfants. Ce prêt lui servira à s'approvisionner en matières premières (mil pour la préparation de la boisson) et des marchandises.

Pour l’avenir, elle espère améliorer son activité et assurer le bien être social à toute sa famille. 

Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs, du soja, du riz. Certaines font le commerce des céréales, du haricot  et espèrent aussi augmenter leurs superficies cultivables.
texts.en:
The DIGNABANA Association is a solidarity group located in the central region of Togo.  The group's representative is named Koudjoukalo.  

Koudjoukalo is a reseller of local drinks and she is married to a farmer.  The couple has five children who all go to school.  Koudjoukalo is 40 years old.  Based in the central region of Togo, she has been working in her field since 2000 and is helped by one person.  She plans to use her earnings to ensure the well-being of her family and to better educate her children.

In the future, Koudjoukalo hopes to improve her business and to ensure the social well-being of her family.

The other members of the group grow maize, soy and rice.  Some sell grains and beans and also hope to increase the surface area of their cultivated lands.

The requested loan will be used to purchase agricultural inputs (fertilizers).

loans.use: Acheter du mil, des engrais et des marchandises.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 52 años de edad, es un citadino al que la oportunidad de  convertirse en microempresario le toco la puerta y el como todo buen colombiano no la desaprovechó. Desde hace 10 años gracias a los programas gratuitos que dictaba la alcaldía de su municipio, adquirió conocimiento sobre la reparación de aparatos eléctricos, lo que le permitió montar su propio negocio y mejorar su condición económica.  
Aunque su vida hoy se encuentra mejor, cuenta que antes de aprender el oficio le tocó laborar en diferentes actividades, “Fui ayudante de construcción y gracias a este trabajo logré ahorrar el dinero para convertirme en microempresario” estas son las palabras de Miguel quien se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le dio la vida de mejorar su condición económica. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y adecuaciones locativas de su local.
Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo y acreditar el negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos y adecuaciones locativas

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: This is Sallay, who is 28 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 4. In 2012, Sallay established her grocery shop business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of their home. Sallay's business is located on the outskirts of town, and her main customers are all classes of people. Working 7 days a week, 10 hours a day, Sallay earns about 600,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from her business. She needs a loan of Le5,000,000 in order to purchase more bags of sugar,bottles of mayonnaise, milk powder, ovaltine,etc for resale to meet the demand of her customers in the community in which she operates. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her stock levels and also her profit. In the future, Sallay plans to extend her shop and begin bar and restaurant services. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Patricia Mariana

texts.es:
Patricia vive en Libertad, tiene 42 años de edad. Ella desde muy pequeña siempre a vendida ropa y joyas, ese ha sido su sustento hasta la actualidad, el trabajo lo realiza sola en la mañana hasta la tarde, vendiendo blusas, pantalones, interiores, etc.

La dificultad que cruza es su enfermedad pero ella depende demasiado del negocio porque ese es lo que la hace seguir adelante, no invierte todo el dinero en ropa se deja un capital para pagar las cosas de la casa.

Es una mujer soltera con un hijo de cinco años que estudia en una escuela fiscal, su hijo es el poder de ella para que cada día se esfuerce mas en las cosas que hace.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, interiores. El sueño que quiere poder realizar con este préstamo es el de que su negocio siga creciendo para así tener mayores ingresos, ya que es sola y sola mantiene a su hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in Libertad and is 42 years of age. From a very young age, she has always sold clothing and jewelry. This is now the means by which she supports herself. Patricia works alone from morning to afternoon, selling blouses, trousers, undergarments, and other items.

The difficulty that she is experiencing is her illness, so she is extremely dependent on her business since it is the means she has by which to get ahead. Patricia does not have all the money she needs to invest in clothing because her capital has been used to pay for household expenses. She is a single mother with a five-year-old son who attends a state school. Her son provides the strength she needs to work harder each day in everything she does.

With this loan, Patricia will buy blouses, trousers, and undergarments. Her dream is to utilize this loan so that her business can keep growing. As a result, she will have more income by which she can support herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and undergarments.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is an entrepreneur who works with a small team of socially minded partners to improve lives for farmers throughout Kenya. Her work involves training farmers and building market linkages with suppliers of environmentally friendly products that are needed within local communities. Over the last several years, Joyce has worked with thousands of low-income farmers that grow tea, coffee, flowers, and vegetables. She started Boma Safi Limited to support the many farmers who lack access to sustainable energy and products that alleviate poverty. 

The Boma Safi product line now includes solar energy solutions, as well as clean cookstoves, water purifiers, and women's health products. These goods are sold directly on farms, as well as in rural open-air markets and two small shops that Joyce now operates. Boma Safi (meaning "clean home" in Swahili) has quickly built a reputation as a trusted voice in the East African Fair Trade community.

Joyce leads a small team that conducts workshops on farms across Kenya, demonstrating the positive aspects of solar when compared to traditional energy sources such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries. With years of experience selling a variety of solar products, Joyce began working with One Degree’s team in Kenya in 2012 after collecting feedback from farmers about BrightBox, a new solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios. During workshops, farmers would exclaim "stima!" - meaning electricity - when seeing BrightBox lights in action, and Joyce knew she found a winning solution.

Since September 2012, Joyce has already sold hundreds of BrightBox systems to farmers. She already has requests for many more, which she would like to provide before the holidays. While happy with her initial success, Joyce has been selling to farmers on a regular cash basis, while many others cannot afford to pay upfront.
