He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has always dedicated all of his efforts to getting his son ahead, as he is both father and mother to his son. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of necessity he had to work from the time he was very young; he was orphaned at a young age. Andrés was not able to finish elementary school, nor was he able to study for a professional career. In his free time he likes to prepare delicious pastries to share with his family. 

Of his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Andrés works at his small business selling ice cream and delicious baked goods, like pastries, alfajores [cookies] and other things. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that his business is going well because of the friendliness he provides to his clients.

Andrés is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to improve his home. He wants to construct a wall of bricks and concrete around the back part of his house. In this way he will have greater security and well-being, and will thus be able to keep working and making an effort to achieve his great dream of being able to have a great bakery.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Violeta Victoria

texts.es:
Violeta es una mujer de 32 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Violeta no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Violeta trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende diversas prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, Violeta trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Violeta se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir, como polos, shorts, blusas, pantalones y otros, de esta manera ella tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues Violeta seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Violeta is a 32-year-old woman, is single and lives in the city of Huaraz with her parents. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of necessity she had to work from a very young age. Violeta wasn't able to study for the professional career of Human Medicine. In her free time she likes to listen to music and sometimes she makes a delicious Arroz con Pollo [chicken and rice dish] to share with her family.

Of her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Violeta works at her small business selling clothing. She sells various kinds of clothing for women, men and children. Violeta works every day for approximately 12 hours and she thinks that her business is going well because of the good prices and friendly treatment that she provides her clients.

Violeta is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing, like shirts, shorts, blouses, pants and other things. In this way she will have her business better stocked and will be able to attend to more clients. Violeta will thus keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Clara Rosa

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para ellos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Clara no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Causa Rellena para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Clara trabaja como encargada recepcionista de un pequeño hospedaje en su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Clara se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder preparar adecuadamente  en su hogar los
alimentos que ella y su familia necesiten, ya que actualmente su cocina presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver feliz a su familia.
texts.en:
Clara is a 58-year-old woman and lives in the city of Nazca with her five children, whom she loves and are her primary motivation for living. She is a friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to getting her family ahead, as she has always been both father and mother to them. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and due to necessity, she had to work from a very young age; Clara wasn't able to study for the professional career of Business Administration. In her free time, she likes to watch movies and sometimes she cooks a delicious Causa Rellena [Peruvian layered potato dish] to share with her family.

Of her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Clara works as a receptionist at a small guesthouse in her city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and believe that her work is going well because she is very responsible and because of the friendly way she treats others.

Clara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy a small stove. This will be very useful in order to prepare properly in her home the food that her family needs.  Currently, her stove is damaged and dangerous to use. In this way she will be able to keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream of seeing her family happy.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Julio Dimas

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Julio no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Julio trabaja en como técnico en una taller de soldadura de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
 Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una maquina soldadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder darle mejores acabados a sus trabajos, así pues Julio seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una buen profesional.
texts.en:
Julio is a 21 year old, single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chiclayo in the Guadalupe district. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who really wants to excel. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Julio has not been able to study to be a professional chef. He would like to be able to do that someday. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and on occasion, cook a delicious dish of rice with duck to share with his family.

Through a lot of hard work, drive and dedication, Julio works as a technician in a soldering shop in his city. He works everyday for about 10 hours a day and believes that things are going well because of his good performance and because of the friendly way he treats others. 

Julio is very grateful for the Kiva micro loans as they will help him purchase his own soldering equipment to give his work better finishes. This will allow him to continue working to achieve his biggest dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: purchase soldering equipment.

loans.name: Ginder Gilberto

texts.es:
Ginder es un hombre de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo, Ginder se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ginder trabaja como técnico en una empresa de vuelos aéreos de su ciudad, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ginder se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de calaminas y madera, lo cuales le servirán de mucho para refacciones el techado de su vivienda, ya que al acercarse las épocas de lluvia desea proteger a su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Ginder is a 30 year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his 2 children, who he loves and who are his main reason for living.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who devotes all of his efforts to getting ahead with his family.  Thanks to his efforts, Ginder is studying for a degree in accounting.  In his free time he enjoys playing with his little ones, and at times he cooks tasty fried rice to share with his family.  

On his own initiative, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Ginder works as a technician in a an airline company in his city.  In addition, during the weekends he works as a moto-taxi driver, providing transportation services.  Ginder works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that his business is doing well because of his responsibility and because of the friendly service he provides to others.


Ginder is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing he will be able to buy corrugated metal roofing material and wood so that can repair the roof of his house.  He needs to do this because when the rainy season comes, he wants to protect his family so that he will be able to continue to work and exert himself in order to achieve his greatest dream: to become a great professional.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his house

loans.name: Yeimi Jacqueline

texts.es:
Yeimi es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Yeimi no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Guiso de Pallares Verdes para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yeimi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Yeimi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, dulces, golosinas, gaseosas y otros, de esta manera Yeimi tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, a fin de brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Yeimi is a woman of 28. She lives in the city of Ica with her husband and their two children, whom she loves and who are her principal focus in life. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who together with her husband dedicates all her efforts to advance her family. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources and because of the need to work since she was very young, Yeimi was not able to study for the professional career in education that she wanted. In her free time, she likes to watch television, and on some occasions she cooks a very delicious green lima bean stew to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Yeimi works in her little business of selling groceries. She works every day for approximately 12 hours, and she believes that it is going well for her because of the good prices and the friendly treatment that she offers to her customers.

Yeimi is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to complete the purchase of a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk, beans, sweets, candies, soft drinks, and other items. In this way, Yeimi will have her business better stocked and will be able to serve more customers, and thus she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of finishing the construction of her house, with the goal of offering better security and well-being to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lourdes Liliana

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Lourdes no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras y calurosas calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tacu Tacu para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lourdes trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lourdes se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un andamio y mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, dulces, golosinas, gaseosas y otros, de esta manera Lourdes tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old and lives in the city of Ica with her young son, who she loves and is her main motivation in life.  She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her effort to improving her family's life, since she is both mother and father to her son.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, and the need to work since she was very young, Lourdes was not able to study Business Administration at the university, but she would have liked to do so.  In her free time, she likes to take walks through the friendly and hot streets of her city and sometimes likes to cook a dish of tacu tacu (fried steak with rice and beans) to share with her family.

By her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Lourdes works at her small business selling groceries.  She works every day for about 12 hours.  She believes it is going well because of her good prices and the friendly treatment she offers to her customers. 

Lourdes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support they provide, she will be able to purchase shelving and merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, soup, candy, sweets, soda, and other items.  This will allow Lourdes to keep her store better stocked and be able to serve more customers.  She wants to continue working and making an effort in order to achieve her dream of having a mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase shelving and merchandise.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Norma no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cuando visita a sus padres, cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Norma trabaja como empleada en una empresa distribuidora de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Norma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño terreno, el cual en un futuro no muy lejano empezará a construir lo que será su propia casa, así pues Norma seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener sus propios hijos y una gran familia.
texts.en:
Norma is a woman of 38. She lives in the city of Nazca. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because of the need to work since she was very young, Norma was not able to study for a professional career. In her free time, she likes to relax by watching television, and sometimes, when she visits her parents, she cooks a very delicious Chinese-Peruvian fried rice to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Norma works as an employee in a distributing business in her city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours, and she believes that it is going well for her because of her good effort and the friendly treatment that she offers to others.

Norma is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, she will be able to complete the purchase of a small plot of land, where in the not very distant future she will begin to build what will be her own house. Thus Norma will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having her own children and a big family.

loans.use: to buy a little plot of land

loans.name: Efrain Guido

texts.es:
Efrain es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus padres, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Efrain no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Efrain trabaja en su pequeña librería, en la cual vende útiles de escritorio y escolares, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Efrain se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio, como libros, cuaderno, loncheras y otros útiles escolares diversos, así pues Efrain seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y poco a poco dese salir adelante.
texts.en:
Efrain is a man of 31. He is single and lives in the city of Huarza with his parents. He is a very friendly person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work since he was very young, Efrain was not able to study for a careen in law. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends, and sometimes he cooks a very delicious potato and tripe stew to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Efrain works in his little bookstore, where he sells stationery and school supplies. He works every day for approximately 12 hours, and he believes that it is going well for him because of the variety of products and the friendly treatment that he offers his customers.

Efrain is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, he will be able to make the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise for his business, such as books, notebooks, lunchboxes, and other various school supplies. Thus Efrain will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own house, and little by little he wants to advance.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es un mujer de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposo y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven de trabajar, Rosa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver novelas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende diversos platos típicos de su ciudad, como tamales, papas rellenas y otros, Rosa trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos, como arroz, azúcar, papas, condimentos y otros, adicionalmente comprará utensilios de cocina para acondicionar su negocio, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman of 58. She lives in the city of Chincha with her husband and their children, whom she loves and who are her principal focus in life. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who together with her husband dedicates all her efforts to advance her family. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because of the need to work since she was very young, Rosa was not able to study for a professional career in education, but she very much would have liked to do it. In her free time she likes to watch soap operas, and sometimes she cooks a very delicious rice with duck to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Rosa works in her little business of selling food. She sells a variety of typical dishes of her city, such as tamales, stuffed potatoes, and others. Rosa works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well for her because of her good flavorings and because of the friendly treatment that she offers her customers.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to make the purchase of a larger quantity of ingredients, such as rice, sugar, potatoes, condiments, and other items. In addition, she will buy cooking utensils to outfit her business. Thus Rosa will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she prepares

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 50 years old, married and has four children. He recycles scrap metal and uses it to make vehicle parts and bicycle spare parts. He has been in business for the past five years. He also practices farming. He is a very hard working man and thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to keep records of his business well. 
Someday he hopes to supply recycled materials. He requests for a loan of 32,298 KES to buy 50 kilograms of scrap metal.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilograms of scrap metal

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is 35 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. She runs a chemist and has been in business for the past three years. She also relies on her husbands income. She used her previous loan to stock more medicine. Her business did well and she repaid her loan. She is a very hard working lady. 
She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to pay school fees. She hopes to open up other chemists.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter a 41 year old man is married and has been blessed with six children. He is a carpenter and has been in business for the past two years. He describes his business as very competitive. He was previously employed as a guard. He is a very hard working and trust worthy man. Faulu Kenya has helped him save his money for future purposes and also boost his business.
He hopes to be a rich man. He requires a loan of 10,428 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a business man who does carpentry. He is married and has been blessed with six children. He has been in business for the past five years and also does part time construction. Faulu Kenya has been of major help to him because his living standards have improved.
He requests a loan of 53,156 KES to pay school fees. Someday he hopes to be a very successful businessman.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio Gregorio pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Gregorio continua trabajando en una empresa de reciclador,reciclando papeles,metal,plasticos entre otros,el socio Gregorio cuenta con una unidad de transporte con el cual trabaja y transporta lo reciclado,el socio Gregorio lleva años en este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,el socio Gregorio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio Gregorio requiere el préstamo para la compra de metales,vidrios,plasticos entre otros.


El  socio Gregorio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the community bank “silkinchany.” The bank is located in the community of Angostura in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The partner continues to work in the recycling company, recycling paper, metals, plastic and other items. The partner depends on a unit of transport with which he works and transports the recyclables.  The partner has worked in this area for years and he is doing well thanks to effort he puts in everyday. The partner wants to continue working in order to continue to support his family. 

The partner needs the loan to purchase matals, glass, and plastic among other items.  The partner is grateful for the help that he has been granted and he promises to be disciplined with his payments and quotas.

loans.use: to purchase metals, glass, plastics, and other items.

loans.name: Rosas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ROSAS DE JUAN PABLO está compuesto por ocho integrantes, todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Sonia tiene 56 años y tiene un hijo ya independiente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en una populosa feria de ciudad de El ALto este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Sonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes.
texts.en:
The Bank of Entrepreneurship ROSAS DE JUAN PABLO is formed by eight members, all women. Sonia is the president of the bank. She is 56 years old and has one son who is independent. She sells second-hand clothing in her stall, which is located in a busy market in the city of el Alto. This loan is her first sequence within the institution. 

Sonia will use the loan to buy second-hand clothing in bulk for her business. The reason she is requesting this loan is because she lacks capital. Sonia is faced with challenges in her business which is competition, as there are many people working in the same activity. 

She is going to use the profits to continue to improve her stall. Her wish for her business is to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 48 years old and married with eight children. She lives in the village of Lasam. She has a small sari-sari store where she sells a variety of products to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more groceries, such as biscuits, candies, sardines, spices and pancit canton, to stock her store. In the future, she plans to start a piggery business as an additional source of income. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as biscuits, candies, sardines, spices and pancit canton, to stock her store

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants(on peut voir son plus petit enfant sur la photo); elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis pratiquement 15 ans. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de petit déjeuné.  Elle est sociétaire  à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a honoré son engagement par rapport à son premier crédit obtenu. Elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit d’un montant de 500.000 francs qui sera destiné à l’achat de produits alimentaires et agroalimentaires qui serviront à la préparation des divers menus  proposés a sa clientèle. Le renforcement de son fond de roulement pourrait avoir comme conséquence  l’augmentation de ses profits, ce qui peut lui offrir l’opportunité de commencer une seconde activité, la vente de produits cosmétiques. Dans le futur, elle projette d’ouvrir un grand restaurant afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mariama lives in Senegal.  She is married and a mother of 5 children (her youngest child is pictured in the photo with her) and has worked in commerce for almost 15 years.  She is now specialized in the sale of breakfasts.

Mariama is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC.  She has already honored a previous commitment with them and repaid her first loan.  She is now requesting another loan of 500,000 francs, which will be used to buy fresh food as well as processed food products.  She will use these supplies to prepare the various dishes which she sells to her customers.

By strengthening her working capital, Mariama might increase her profits, which may give her the opportunity to start a second activity, such as selling cosmetic products.  

In the future, Mariama is planning to open a large restaurant in order to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy food supplies to prepare the meals that she sells.

loans.name: Virgen De Schoensttat Group

texts.es:
El grupo se denomina Virgen de Schoensttat, las integrantes viven en Ciudad del Este está en su ciclo número 3. Las integrantes están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza y con ello han mejorado mucho sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y su trabajo continuo ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero ella lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de hierbas medicinales para la venta y así seguir teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Virgen de Schoensttat, its members live in Ciudad del Este and they are working their 3rd cucle. They take part in the poverty elimination program, thanks to which they have greatly improved their standard of living.
Mirta is a member of this group, and her latest survey indicated that she is within a Level 2 poverty stage. By working constantly and thanks to her efforts she is improving her poverty status. She engages in selling natural remedies, a very demanding activity she nonetheless carries out in order to help her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy medicinal herbs to sell, in order to keep on earning what she needs to support her family.

loans.use: To buy medicinal herbs to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza pasa al cuarto ciclo, todas las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas y cerdos también venden huevos y quesos. Todas ellas se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del trabajo unido de ellas salir adelante y luchar por sus familias.
Luisa también cría animales y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y granos para sus animales y de esa forma poder seguir con lo que viene haciendo hasta hoy.
Luisa está muy esperanzada en que con su comité podrán crecer y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
texts.en:
La Esperanza (Hope) is a Committee currently working its fourth cycle. All the members engage in breeding farmyard animals such as chickens and pigs, selling eggs and cheeses as well. They all joined forces to help each other out and to get ahead and fight for their families by working together.
Luisa engages in animal breeding, and she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and grains for her animals, in order to keep on engaging in her activity.
Luisa deeply hopes that the members of her Committee will succeed in progressing and in helping each other out

loans.use: To buy animal feed and grains.

loans.name: Sabanoh Group

texts.en:
Gbassay is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Gbassay was born in northern Sierra Leone, 19 years ago. Gbassay is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Gbassay sells toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, body lotions, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Gbassay and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Gbassay will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone Leones) to buy toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, body lotions, etc., in a larger quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, body lotions, etc., in a larger quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: La Gran Amistad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Gran Amistad este formado por 8 mujeres que son amigas, viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de hermoso paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada y sus verdes campos producto de los sembríos de su población, esta parroquia crecer cada día más en el comercio gracias a su gente. Las socias al igual que la mayor parte de su gente se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad, algunos han dejado a sus familias y han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades, pero a pesar del crecimiento que tiene esta parroquia aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Bernardita,  tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 12 hijos, 7 de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus 5 hijos solteros tienen 17, 15, 14, 10 y 8 años de edad, dos estudian en el colegio, un hijo es discapacitado por lo que pasa en casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil. Viven en una casa prestada pero tiene una casa propia en otro cantón.

Doña Bernardita desde muy joven se dedica  a la agricultura y a la cría de cuyes y gallinas, esta actividad económica lo aprendió de sus padres, ahora este trabajo le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y salir en adelante. Siempre le gusto este trabajo ya que le da el tiempo para estar en casa, cuidar de su hogar, sus animales y  de sus cultivos los cuales los vende en un mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca, depende del día sus productos se venden a buenos y malos precios, pero siempre es optimista y espera que cada día sea mejor que el otro. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para todos sus animales y pollos.
 
Su meta es de seguir superándose y brindarle una mayor estabilidad a su familia.

loans.use: Comprar alimento para animales y pollos.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: to improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: 01.10.04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Viễn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle for raise and resell in the future.

Viễn is 62 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Viễn is the group leader of the 01.10.04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. 
Her chidren are grown up so Vân supports no dependent. with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Viễn first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Viễn has been involved in this business for 2 years.
The main harship that Viễn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Viễn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle for raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Imelda Virginia

texts.en: A few years ago, Imelda's daughter Jamilet, now 4 years old, was playing in the kitchen with fire when unexpectedly the fire exploded severely burning Jamilet.  She has limited movement of her left arm and cannot raise it more than half way. Imelda is a single mother who supports her eight children by selling candies and gum. This loan will help her pay for corrective surgery for her daughter to allow her normal function, vastly improving her quality of life and future opportunities. It is anticipated that a single surgery will completely restore her arm movement.

loans.use: to restore physical movement of her arm after severe burns

loans.name: René Ovidio

texts.en: Rene, his parents, and two siblings, all work in their small family-run business. They sell toys, school supplies and non-perishable food products to local community members from their home. A few years ago Rene's mother was ironing the family's clothes when, in a brief moment, wanting to assist his mother, Rene grabbed the hot iron severely burning his index finger. In time this cause his finger to curl into his hand because of the resultant burn scar contracture. As a result Rene is unable to grasp different objects securely with his left hand. This loan will enable reconstructive plastic surgery to restore his hand function including the use of tools.

loans.use: corrective surgery of burn contracture on left index finger

loans.name: Sureydi Marioli

texts.en: Sureydi is an 18-year-old single mother. Her son Adrian was born with a cleft lip and is now 1 1/2 years old. Cleft lip is a medical condition that makes it difficult for children to eat or speak. Many also face social discrimination and are unable to attend school as a result. Sureydi lacks the financial resources to seek medical assistance for her son. She and Adrian live with her parents who work as farmers in a rural indigenous community. This loan will help her pay for life-changing corrective surgery for Adrian, vastly improving his quality of life and future opportunities.

loans.use: corrective surgery of a child's cleft lip

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary a 45 year old woman, is married and has been blessed with two children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in business for the past six years. She supplies milk in her area. She is a very hard working lady. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has learnt how to save her money and also socialize with other people. 
She hopes to improve the living standards of her family. She requires a loan of 94,871 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 50 years old, married and has four children. She sells potato fries and has been in business for three years. She is a very hard working and humble woman. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to maintain proper records of her business.
She hopes to be financially stable. She requires a loan of 32,298 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Consorcio La Semilla Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONSORCIO LA SEMILLA II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes Malena ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos, la socia vende licuadoras, ollas, sartenes y cocinas, la socia también vende repuestos de electrodomésticos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en su negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos como licuadoras, ollas y sartenes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de repuestos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de salón de belleza y negocio de restaurant.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Consorcio La Semilla II Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Lourdes Malena, 36, has a partner and two children.  She works in her business selling appliances.  She sells blenders, pots, frying pans, and stoves.  She also sells appliance parts.  She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has seven years of experience in her business and it's going well for her.  Her dream is to expand her space where she has her appliance business.

She's requesting the loan to buy appliances such as blenders, pots, and frying pans.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo had permission to take the photos after the meeting because of work.

The other members make their livings selling spare parts, selling clothing, with a beauty salon, and with a restaurant. 

She's grateful to those who are part of this dream through this loan and she pledges to make her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy blenders, pots, and frying pans

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Cesar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cesar trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá culminar la construcción de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ya que desea construir las paredes y comprar los accesorios para acondicionar su baño, de esta manera él y su familia podrán contar mayor higiene, salubridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de salir adelante.

loans.use: Para la construcción de sus servicios higiénicos

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena needs a loan of 300,000 Albanian Lek to build a hay barn. “When you’ve got animals, it’s important to have a hay barn, to store the animal food and fodder. Living in the rural north, we are faced with bizarre weather conditions, most of the time; sometimes flooding, other times severe snowing…,” Prena said.
Prena has been operating a livestock business for the past twenty two years. She has been selling milk to a nearby local farm and also baby calves to the locals.

Prena is 48 and married. She has three children ranging in age from 27 to 18 with the youngest one attending school.

loans.use: To build a hay barn

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred has been operating his own carpentry shop for about five years now and the recent years his business has been experiencing growth according to him.
Alfred is 29 years old and married; he has 2-year-old twins. They live in the northern Albania, yet prior to this current location they lived further up in the north.” Life there was very difficult; we were trapped by snow for six months. We couldn‘t come out of our homes. So, during the summer time we would stock up on food and other survival items for the winter. Poor animals they couldn’t resist the extreme cold weather and they often died. Our living was extremely poor. Now we live here and are much better and we are glad that we made such a move. We experienced difficulties in the very beginning, but now we are happy.” Alfred said.
Alfred will use this loan to buy raw material for his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona is 45 and lives close by a little town in the northern part of the country. She is married and has three children; twenty is the oldest and nine is the youngest and they all go to school respectively. 
For the past five years, Valbona has been taking care of her animals and has been selling their milk produce to the locals. It’s a family activity where each one of us offers something. This makes it easier for me, otherwise livestock is not an easy task, because you have to feed  and milk the animals, clean their stable, prepare fodder for the winter time and take the milk to the locals, ” she said smiling. 
Valbona is requesting a loan to purchase another milk cow and this will be her second loan with the previous one being paid off.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and this will be additional to her existing herd

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is requesting a loan to buy fabric raw material
Marte is in her early sixties and lives in the northern Albania with the rest of her family. She widowed seventeen years ago when the youngest child was only one year old. “But I managed to raise all of them, and this makes me happy today looking back. I make traditional costumes for living and I have been doing this for the past almost thirty years. It is a good way of making a good income, “Marte said.
Kindly note that; to this day, some conservative old men and women, mainly from the North wear traditional clothing in their daily lives. Instead, older women from the South usually wear all black outfits. Almost every region in Albania has its own traditional dress with women clothing being particularly colorful and rich in detail.

loans.use: To buy fabric raw material to make traditional costums

loans.name: Margjela

texts.en:
Margjela is fifty five years old and lives in the north. She is the mother of seven children with some of them still attending schools; the youngest one is five years old and the oldest is twenty nine. 
Margjela has been selling items on the beach during summer time from a booth and also elsewhere during other seasons.” It has been profitable and I enjoy it,” Margjela said. “I have a booth that I operate it throughout the year almost, but winter,” she continued. 
Margjela has been a long time and good client of VisionFund Albania. She has paid all of her loans on time without any delays and she is requesting another loan this time to stock up on items to resell.

loans.use: To stock up the booth on inventory items to resell

loans.name: Chizigwa

texts.en:
Chizigwa is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married farmer, a trade she has done for 10 years. She looks forward to commercial farming. She has six children, most of whom are in school.

Chizigwa was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 14,196.40 Kenyan shillings to purchase a solar lamp. She understands this will help the children study better at night and reduce the health hazards related to smoke and soot from paraffin lamps.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jasinta

texts.en:
Jasinta is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. 

Jasinta operates a drinks retail store where she sells sodas. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located at a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of soda. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more soda to sell. 

Her business goal is to be a distributor of soda within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Her business is selling cosmetics. She visits shops, offices and private houses.

She needs this loan to buy creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products, as she has made good sales and, as a result, her number of customers and the number of orders she receives has increased. This is very positive for her as it means her income will increase, and she will be able to provide her child with a decent life. She would like her child to finish school and she would also like to be able to finish building her modest home.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Jeneba. She is married and has four children, aged 23, 19, 17, and 14. 

In 1996, Jeneba established her condiments business. She began her business just to contribute to the running of the home. Her business is located at a city center market and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 240,000 every month from this business. 

Jeneba would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy tomatoes - Le 1,750,000, a sack of onions - Le 2,000,000, and a carton of Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews) - Le 250,000. 

Jeneba hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, she still has the plan of developing her table into a shop. She is saying thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oil, onions, Irish potatoes, jumbo Maggi, sugar and tomatoes.

loans.name: Blancanieve

texts.es:
Blancanieve esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior que ha recibido de Kiva, ya que con ello ha podido surtir su negocio y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Ella hoy está casada con el Sr. Ricardo de 29 años con quien trabaja por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, arroz, harina, yerba, fideos, etc. y con esto poder seguir surtiendo su despensa y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Blancanieve is very grateful for the previous loan she has received from Kiva. It is because of the loan that she has been able to stock her business and continue giving her customers everything they need. Currently, she is married to Mr. Ricardo, 29, who she works with to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles, and other thigs, so that she can continue stocking her store and offering a nice variety for her customers.

She is grateful for this new opportunity she is receiving because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles, and other things for her pantry store.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a 40-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 11 to 15 years. He describes himself to be an optimistic and focused man. He operates a tailoring retail store where he sells the clothes he makes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the business environment. 

Raymond also runs an agrovet retail store, and this business adds to his income. He plans to use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy agrovet products to sell so as to improve the business . His business goal is to run more agrovet retail stores within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy agrovet products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: to improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: to improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is a businessman in Malindi, and is grateful to be associated with Milango. 

Though he had applied for his first loan last month, he provided the wrong bank details, and therefore the transaction could not proceed. 

He has reapplied for the loan, and is asking for 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy food stocks, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking fat etc.

loans.use: to buy food stocks, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking fat etc.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is taking out another Kiva loan. Her dream was always to have a very spacious general store so that she could offer good service to each one of her customers. Now, thanks to her efforts, and also the help that Yehu Microfinance Trust offers, she has her own general store.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy more products for her general store, such as drinks, tea leaves, rice, milk, bread and other items so that her daily sales volume increases. This way she can meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products for her general store, such as drinks, tea leaves, rice, milk, bread and other items.

loans.name: Maize Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of Maize Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 3 men. Sarah is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of land for sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Sarah first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Sarah joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for her family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Sarah reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 13 bags per acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and possibly buy some cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Sarah’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: David Edison's Group

texts.en:
Meet this group of teachers from the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

David is the featured leader of this group. The 58-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a businesswoman and has nine children, some of whom are attending primary and secondary school. David has been a school teacher for a number of years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his childrens' school fees.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000. 

With the loan, she wants to offer various treatments, such as hair cuts, hair coloring, nail painting, makeovers and a variety of other services. She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has employed one person to help her, since she alone cannot tend to her numerous clientele, who like to come to her because of her excellent work. 

She also sells beauty and personal hygiene products, which she offers while she works on her clients. Patricia has had her salon for years, and it has been going very well for her.

loans.use: to provide hair coloring, nail painting and makeovers.

loans.name: Mamboleo Group

texts.en:
Mamboleo Group is located in Chwele District and consists of three women and six men. Gaudencia, the group leader, is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is requesting an input loan to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate a ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Gaudencia joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Gaudencia joined One Acre Fund to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer to grow enough food for her family.

Gaudencia described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Gaudencia’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 4.5 acres of land. 

Alice one of the farmers of Mamboleo Group, chose to drop out of the program after this Kiva photo was taken. She is still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Speed Way Organisation Group

texts.en:
The Speed Way Organization group is based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  With their first loan from SMT/Kiva, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Lamin.  Lamin is 35 years old.  He was born in Bo district, in southern Sierra Leone, but is currently residing in Koidu with his wife and 4 children.  His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary schools.  Lamin is a tailor and has been in this profession for 10 years now.  He has requested for this loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS. She is married and has three children.

Jennifer has a shop that sells food. She has had this business for 13 years. She request a loan to have a extra capital for her store.

Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Jennifer hopes to have a new store.

loans.use: to have capital for her food stall.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Hola  de Perú,   Un grupo conformado por 10  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de Ate Vitarte. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “los Ángeles de Vitarte” una de ellas es la Sra. Doris de 46 años soltera y sin  hijos, la Sra. Doris  se dedica ya hace 5 años a la fabricación de sabanas   en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia , Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Doris   ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio , su mayor sueño en la vida es tener una empresa de telas  , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más telas  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Hello from Perú.  

This communal bank group is made up of 10 responsible women working in various industries. Each of the women live in the district of Ate Vitarte. They call themselves the "Angels of Vitarte." One member of this group is Doris. She is 46 years old, single and has no children. For the last five years, Doris has made a living making sheets in a small store each day with the goal of helping her family to get ahead. With her earnings thus far, Doris has been able to improve her house and her quality of life. She hopes to continue improving. Her biggest dream is to own a fabric business.

With this loan, Doris will invest in more fabric in order to increase her earnings. She sends hugs to Kiva and Edaprospo as well as her thanks for the loan that helps make her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy more fabric.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for five years. Besides this, he also sells water and is formally employed. Mathias is a married father of one child.

Mathias is asking for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal for sale. He will pay for his child’s school fee from the extra income. 

Despite the challenge of bad debts, Mathias believes the business has a future. Besides being able to get the income to educate his children, he looks forward to owning more water-vending stalls in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and lives in Kisauni, Mombasa. David and his wife, together, have been able to raise four children. David has a well-stocked store, selling household consumables. He is a hardworking and responsible person, who is getting ahead with his hard work. Thanks to his work, he has given his children what they needed to have a dignified life, without deprivation.

He is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods, and more. He says that his goal is to be able to keep growing with his business and keep gaining customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Ramona Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Ramona vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 58 años de edad. Ella emprendió esta actividad de hacer jugos con hielo granizado, gracias a una idea de un amigo de ella, y así pudo criar a su hijo de 5 años. 
Ella vende sus jugos de hielo granizados sola, y lo realiza de 10:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 de la tarde. 

La dificultad que a ella se le presenta en su trabajo es por parte de los ladrones que muchas veces intentan apoderarse de sus ganancias diarias. Ella no está casada, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar hielo, esencias para los granizados y otra parte del crédito utilizar para su casa en ladrillo, cemento, etc. Ella desea que su hijo sea un profesional para que pueda defenderse solo en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ramona, age 58, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  She undertook this business activity of making juices with crushed ice thanks to an idea from a friend of hers.  This way she was able to take care of her five year old child.

She sells her juices with crushed ice alone from 10:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

The difficulty she faces in her work is that the thieves often try to take her daily earnings.

She is not married, and she has a five year old daughter, who goes to a public school.

She will use the loan to buy ice and flavoring for the crushed ice.  She will use the other part of the loan for bricks and cement, etc. for her house.

She wishes that her child will become a professional so that she is able to fend for herself in the future.

loans.use: to buy ice, flavoring, cement, and bricks.

loans.name: Isabel Antonia

texts.es:
La Clienta Isabel vive en La Libertad, tiene ella 44 años de edad. Ella empezó a vender productos en su casa para así poder tener ingresos económicos para su hogar, porque no había nadie para que le diera dinero, y como le fue muy bien decidió implementar su más su negocio para convertirlo en una tienda de víveres. 

Ella atiende la tienda  todos los días de la semana, de lunes a viernes. El único inconveniente que se le presenta en su negocio es los ladrones de su barrio, que intentan arrebatar las ganancias del día. 

 Ella es soltera el esposo la abandono. No tiene hijos. El préstamo lo usara para comprar víveres para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos, etc. Ella desea tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and lives in La Libertad.  She started selling products out of her house because she needed to generate household income since there was no one else who was earning money.  Isabel decided to grow her business even more by turning it into a grocery store.  

Isabel manages her store every weekday, Monday through Friday.  The only challenge that she faces in her business is dealing with neighborhood thieves who try to steal her daily earnings.  Isabel is single since her husband abandoned her.  She has no children.  

This loan will be used to buy products for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, juices, and other items.  Isabel would like to have her own commercial shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, juices, and other products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy(whose photo shows that she plants bananas) lives in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is fifty years of age, married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She has been an active farmer for over thirty years, dealing with horticultural crops and dairy livestock.

Nancy has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES 40,000, which is to be used to purchase dairy goats. She wants to have over five thousand dairy goats and be the leading milk producer. The income from this business will help her pay school fees for her children.

The challenges that Nancy faces are poor markets, unfavourable climatic conditions, and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Taddeo

texts.en:
Taddeo is a hardworking man, who has four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to higher levels of learning, and to set up sustainable income-generating activities so as to secure their future.

His main business is shoe-selling, and he also farms to boost his income. He faces a challenge of increased competition, while his dream is to diversify business to include clothes. Taddeo is requesting a loan to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: 01.09.03 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cử is 65 years old and married with two children; they are grown up and not dependent on her. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She has a service business repairing phones; she has been doing this for three years. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Cử is the group leader of the 01.09.03 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2011, Cử joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to repair phones.

With her business profit, Cử hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business to do well, and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to repair phones.

loans.name: Selinda Isabel

texts.es: La señora selinda es una madre soltera, que cuenta con dos hijas, una de 6 años y una de 5 años, vive  a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad. La señora se dedica al servicio de expendio de comidas, vende en el mercado, este mercado se encuentra al otro extremo de la ciudad en relación a la ubicación de su domicilio. La señora vende en un puesto prestado de una señora donde vende ya hace dos años,  el plato especial que vende es el picante de pollo y la sopa de maní, la señora necesita el crédito para poder comprar una nueva cocina y utensilios para poder vender mejor ya que la cocina que tiene está un poco dañada, así podrá mejorara sus ingresos y  su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Sra. Selinda is a single mother with two daughters, ages 6 and 5.  She lives approximately 45 minutes away from the city.  

Sra. Selinda sells food from a space in the city market.  This market is on the other side of the city in relation to where her home is located.  Sra. Selinda sells from a stall that she is borrowing from another woman and has been in this location for two years.  Her specialty dishes are spicy chicken and peanut soup.  

Sra. Selinda needs a loan in order to buy a new stove and utensils so that she can sell more.  Her current stove is slightly damaged, so the loan will enable her to improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Saidu. He is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 3 months. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him for schooling.

In 2009, Saidu established his cosmetics  business. He began his business just to engage himself in economic activities. His business is located in the heart of town and his main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Saidu has already received and successfully repaid two previous loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy earrings (500,000 SLL), necklace (750,000 SLL) and bracelet (500,000 SLL). He hopes that this loan will increase his income level, which will enable him adequately solve his domestic problems.

In the future, Saidu plans to build a house, buy a private car, and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past six years, Nelson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread, etc. 

To help expand his business, Nelson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more grocery items  to sell, and will help Nelson to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Nelson hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business of the same kind. 

Nelson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nelson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to stock more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Aliitasi has requested a loan to buy equipment and fertilizer to make her business better. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Aliitasi hopes to expand her business in the future and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer,wheel barrow,shovels,bush knives..

loans.name: Twiyiteho Group

texts.en:
Berancile is 56 years old and married to a businessman. They both have six children who all go to school. Berancille is a group leader of “TWIYITEHO,” meaning “Work for our own” in English. She sells different items in her boutique, which she has been running for 20 years. 

She has requested this loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, maize, and bananas for sale. She would like to use the profits for building up savings. Berancille in the picture holds a blue book as an identification as the group leader.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale such as beans, maize, and bananas.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Annah operates a food-making business of beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She wants to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking  oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 43-year-old, married man who has ten children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a tailor, who makes men's suits and is always updated with the current style trends, thus attracting many customers. Inadequate capital hinders his business growth, while his dream is to own a fashion house. Moses intends to use the loan to buy cloth materials for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 33 years old, married to James; both were blessed with three children between the ages of nine years and two years old. She is a hardworking woman who is in the business of selling second-hand clothes and also has rental houses with a good income.

Rahab is applying for her third loan from KADET in the amount of KES 70,000 which she plans to use to purchase more stock of second-hand clothes for sale. The anticipated profit will be used to buy another plot or a land. 

She hopes to make a profit from this loan to enable her to start other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase for more stock of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Panai

texts.en:
Panai is 33 years old. He is married to Alice, and they are blessed with four children between the ages of seven years old to one year old. Panai has been in the farming business for the last eight years with the monthly income of12,000 KES.

He has borrowed his fifth loan from KADET LTD of 50,000 KES to purchase seeds for planting and fertilizers. Panai will use the anticipated profit to buy more lands for agriculture.

His hope and dream is to educate his children well and have enough land for agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance has operated a poultry selling business for the past years, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inadequate working capital and stiff competition. Her dream is to establish a boutique in the near future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase poultry feed and add more chicken to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures, and she appreciates the previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and add more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, age 45, is married and has five children. They own a house that has electricity  but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a business renting tents and chairs. She operates at the market, and her customers include town dwellers and those who have functions.
