She faces a challenge of misplacement of chairs, which leads to losses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more tents and chairs for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more tents and chairs for her rental business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Hoima, Uganda. Due to his passion for farming he started a seed nursery business three years ago and supplemented it with trade in timber. He dreams of improving his household income and educating his children. Weather and bad roads affect his business, while his dream is to diversify business and grow maize extensively after accessing the ready market. Simon is requesting a loan to hire labor for plowing his land where he intends to plant maize.

loans.use: to hire labor for plowing his land where he intends to plant maize.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti aged 40 years, is married and has been blessed with one child who has completed schooling. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a café business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentions that stiff competition has been her major challenge. She dreams of expanding her business to a big hotel in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase food stuff such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access  loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stuff such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves

loans.name: Fatou Lokar's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois créé le 22 décembre 2010, est composé par des femmes du même village. Des femmes dynamiques et solidaires. Elles font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Debout à droite de la photo, Thiata est âgée de 35 ans. Elles mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle fait parti du Banc Villageois et depuis son adhésion elle exerce l'embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 4 moutons et leur nourriture. 
Avec le reste de l'argent elle va acheter du mil qu'elle va stocker pour le revendre au moment opportun.
Les bénéfices gagnés lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The banc villageois established December 22, 2010 is composed of women from the same village. These women are dynamic and supportive of each other. They make a living through commerce and from raising and fattening animals. 

Standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand, Thiata is 35 years old, married, and a mother of six children, including two boys. She is a member of the banc villageois and since she joined, she has been raising and fattening sheep. With this loan, she is going to buy four sheep and their feed. With the rest of the money, she is going to buy millet to store and resell when the time is right. 

The income earned will allow her to support her family and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet and four sheep to fatten

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze, aged 35 years, is married and has been blessed with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. Mbodze dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase retail shop items of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. Mbodze joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop items of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mariecho

texts.en: Mariecho is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a food and retail shop (sari-sari store) where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Mariecho became a member of HSPFI this year, 2013. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carinsan

texts.en: Carinsan is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Carinsan has a tailoring shop where she makes/stitches different kinds of dresses and other products made from textiles. She has had this business for almost 7 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of different kinds of textiles, threads and pins and cloth. Carinsan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carinsan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth , thread , pins and more for the tailoring business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. Perla has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for almost 11 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy snacks, canned goods and vegetables to sell. Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell including snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Janitha

texts.en:
Janitha is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Janitha has a food/retail shop or 'sari-sari' store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Janitha joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Janitha hopes to improve her business to benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more  items to sell ( groceries, snacks, beverages)

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Lilibeth has operated a 'sari-sari' (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

 Lilibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell (groceries, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Rodelyn has a food/retail shop or 'sari-sari' store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for almost six  years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

 Rodelyn joined HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Rodelyn hopes to improve her business to benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell (groceries, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Jackelina

texts.en: Jackelina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jackelina has a store that sells hardware items like saws, hammers, masking tape, and glue guns and more. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more items to sell. Jackelina has been  a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jackelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her hardware store

loans.name: Marve

texts.en: Marve is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a souvenir shop that sells printed t-shirts in their local community. She has had this business for 10 years. Marve requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy different colors of pants and different sizes of t-shirts. Marve has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy stocks of t-shirts and a variety of colors of pants.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child. Elvira has a store that sells fruits like bananas and oranges, apples, durian, mangoesteen, mangoes and some root crops. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more fruits to sell. Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en: Joselyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child. Joselyn has a stall that sells a variety of fruits. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy a larger variety of fruits to sell in the market. Joselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a hardworking mother who lives Nyamasaria in Kisumu. She is married to Barnabas, who is a businessman, and has four children who are 25, 21, 18 and 15 years old.

Eunice sells cereals, a business she has been doing for last three years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings. She has applied for her fourth loan to buy more cereals like maize, beans and groundnuts for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business, hence, more income. She has a dream of making her business more stable to help her purchase a piece of land and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is a 45-year-old single woman. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She is living with her parents.

For the last 10 years, DIlara has been growing and selling fruits. Her father also helps her in this business, which is the only source of income for her family. Dilara chose this business because it is profitable. In Azerbaijan, fruits are in very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruits a lot. In addition to her fruit sales, she also sells vegetables. People use fresh vegetables and fruits every day and consider them healthy.

Dilara sells fruits and vegetables in the bazaar and sometimes from her house. Her monthly profit from this business is 80 AZN. Regarding the expansion of her business, Dilara is really optimistic about her future. She has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. She has completed four previous loans from AqroInvest, and she is considered a good customer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en:
Nuraddin is 51 years old. He is married and has three daughters and one son. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. For the past 15 years, Nuraddin has been breeding cattle and cows. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolmas. 

He usually buys calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, then sells them at a profit at the local livestock bazaar. He also keeps milk cows for his family’s use and for making milk products such as yogurt to sell to his neighbors. His son helps him in this business. His monthly profit is 170 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

Nuraddin is applying for a 2,000 AZN loan. This will be his seventh loan, and he has a good client history. He wants to improve his business and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves to sell in future

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a young man aged 27, married, and has three children. He resides in Nkubu, Eastern Kenya. He has ventured in farming for ten years, producing and selling horticultural crops in the local market.

Titus has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase irrigation equipment. He says that because of this equipment there will be free-flowing water on the farm and thus improve the yield and increase profit levels. Higher profit will improve their living standards. The challenges that he faces are insufficient funds, insufficient farm inputs, and crop pests and diseases. 

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for funding him.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Nkubu, is married, and has three children. She has been a farmer for over twenty years, dealing mostly with cereals.
Jane has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.20,000 to purchase rabbits. This will increase her level of income and hence improve her family's living standards. In the future she wants to have a pick-up of her own. Her major challenges are crop pests and diseases, and insufficient funds.
She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for improving her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy resides in Nkubu, is married and has three children. She has practiced mixed farming for 11 years, producing and selling bananas, maize, beans, potatoes and milk.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) for purchasing a chuff cutter. This will provide better feeds for her cattle and hence, produce more milk to bring about an increase in income. She will be able to better her children's education. 

Her major challenge is pests and diseases. She says that Juhudi Kilimo has done wonders for her farming.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane resides in Nkubu, is married and has three children. She has been in farming for the past eight years, growing bananas, coffee, maize and beans. Besides farming, she also has a hotel and butchery businesses.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) for purchasing water tanks and water pipes. This will help her circulate water evenly in the farm. She says that through this loan, she will advance her children's education, and there will be more food production. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy water tanks and water pipes.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is 40 years old. She is a single mother with sons. She is a very hardworking parent who is taking care of her children alone, and this is very hard. Sevil lives in her own home and enjoys her sons, who are in school.  

Sevil sells phone accessories. She has fifteen years’ experience working in this profession, which she does every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. She loves her business. From this business, her monthly profit is 400 AZN.

Sevil usually sells telephone accessories because everybody is using mobile telephones. In the modern society, young-aged people need such products, so there is a big demand for these products.

Now Sevil needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. This investment will help her to improve the business, since this way she will make profits to support her family. Her dreams are for her children, so that they can stay in school and have successful careers in the future, and to offer a better quality of life to her family. She has a good loan history and this is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to improve the business and buy furnuture for her shop

loans.name: Penda's Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe est créé depuis janvier 2010.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village;elles ont pour activité principale l'agriculture et le petit commerce.

La représentante du groupe est celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,elle est mariée et âgée de 55 ans.

Son activité principale est l'agriculture.En période séche elle pratique le petit commerce de légumes.

Avec le prêt reçu,elle va acheter de l'arachide,du mais pour constituer un stock pour les semences et l'autre stock le revendre.
texts.en:
This group was created in January 2010. It is composed of members who come from the same village. For a living, the members of this group engage in farming and commerce. 

The representative of the group is the one who is on the very right of the photo with her hand raised. She is married and is 55 years old. She is a farmer. In the dry season, she sells vegetables. 

With this loan, she is going to buy groundnuts and corn, some of which will be used as seed stock and some of which will be sold.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, corn, and vegetables

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe a été créé en janvier 2010.IL est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même localité.Elles ont comme principale activité l'agriculture.

celle qui est en position assise sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe.Son activité principale est l'agriculture et le petit commerce en saison séche.

Avec son crédit elle compte acheter du mil et du mais pour les semences pré-hivernage et revendre l'autre partie du stock.

Avec le bénéfice réalisé,elle compte augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: This group was created in January 2010. It consists of members who come from the same area.  Their main business is agriculture.  The woman who is seated in the photo is the manager of the group.  Her main activity is agriculture and during the dry season, it is small trade.  With her loan she plans to millet and corn for pre-rainy season seeds and to resell the other part of the inventory.  With the profits earned, she plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet and corn.

loans.name: Bartholomew Kimutai Langat

texts.en:
Bartholomew lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has 10 children and has been doing this work (agriculture) for 40 years.  His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "milking dairy cows." According to Bartholomew, his biggest challenge is "lack of enough funds." One animal on the farm is named Chebois.

Bartholomew was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. "Because it has low rates," he replied. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said "They are for our economic improvement, and they are good."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?," Bartholomew replied it will "increase sources of income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Bartholomew owns at least one cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting and electricity, but does not have solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
My name is Adela, I am married and have three children ages 10, 8 and 7 years old. I work in a convenience store all week. I started and have been working in the store for the last 8 years, I sell mostly food and also sell prepared snacks such as chicharrones, frituras and candies.

My biggest accomplishment is that i build my house and my goal is to grow my business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for my convenience store, I can get better prices and increase sales.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha vive en una comunidad de Juarez, NL, que se encuentra algo alejada de la Zona Metropolitana de Monterrey. Desde hace varios años, Villa Juárez vive un grave problema de inseguridad, con altos índices de  asesinatos principalmente relacionados al narcotráfico. A pesar de esto, Martha es una persona muy alegre y se ha propuesto compartir algo de su felicidad con sus vecinos. 

Desde hace 6 años, la Sra Martha acondicionó una habitación que construyó al lado de su hogar para establecer un pequeño salón de fiestas infantiles, en donde promueve el buen ambiente y ratos de felicidad a las familias de su comunidad. En estos convivios familiares, sus vecinos pueden olvidarse por algunos momentos de todos los problemas de inseguridad y desempleo que rodean a la comunidad de Villa Juárez. Con mucho esfuerzo, y gracias a su buena administración, la Sra. Martha poco a poco ha ido añadiendo a su negocio varios accesorios para que los niños jueguen como inflables, brincolines, carritos, sillas y mesas, entre otros.

Ella acudió a Credituyo solicitando apoyo para ampliar su local para que puedan caber más personas ya que afortunadamente ha tenido buena demanda. Además, piensa adquirir algunas mesas y sillas adicionales para acondicionar esa ampliación de su negocio. En un futuro a Martha le gustaría llegar a tener más salones de fiestas en comunidades de bajos recursos y poderlos rentar a un muy bajo costo, para que más familias puedan tener un rato alegre y olvidarse por un pequeño momento de sus problemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha lives in the community of Juarez, NL, which is somewhat removed from the metropolitan area of Monterrey. For several years, Villa Juárez has been living with a serious problem of insecurity, mostly the high rate of drug-related murders. Despite these circumstances, Martha remains a cheerful person who is willing to share some of her happiness with her neighbors.

Six years ago, Sra. Martha equipped her home by building an adjacent structure for setting up a small facility for hosting children’s parties. She is able to promote a good atmosphere and create moments of happiness for the families in her community. While at these family get-togethers, her neighbors are able to forget for a few moments about all of the problems related to insecurity and unemployment that have impacted the community of Villa Juárez. With great effort and good management, Sra. Martha has gradually added several accessories to her business so that the children can play such as inflatable bouncy houses, miniature play cars, tables and chairs, and other items.

Martha approached Credituyo in order to request assistance so that she can expand her business and accommodate more people. Fortunately, she has generated a good level of demand. Martha also plans to acquire additional tables and chairs to accommodate the expansion of her business. In the future, Martha would like to open more party facilities in other low-income communities so that people can rent them at minimal cost. This will allow more families the opportunity to have a good time and forget about their problems for a brief moment.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her party facility.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
My name is Mario, I sell candies and chocolates inside different flee market in Mexico City. My father had the same business and I used to work with him.

I got married 10 years ago, and decided to become independent, that is when I started my own shop. I sell my candies in different flee markets. Monday I am in San Pablo Tlanepantla, Tuesday I move to a market in Nicolas Romero, Wednesday in Atizapan and a different market every day.

Thanks to the business, my family is doing much better. My next goal is to build a house.

loans.use: To buy merchandise. I sell candies and chocolates inside flee markets.

loans.name: Mayra Fabiola

texts.en:
My name is Mayra. I am 23 years old and live with my parents in Iztapalapa, Mexico. I started my gift shop when I was 17 years old with a Mx$5000 investment outside my parents home. Through hard work, I have been able to grow my business and now I sell both retail and wholesale.

I will use the loan to buy more merchandise and increase my sales. I try to provide my clients with good quality products at reasonable prices.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
My name is Teresa, I  am 49 years old, I left school after finishing lower school and started working with my parents.

I work in a family business that manufactures underwear and sells to small distributors in a flee market in Texmelucan. We have been in the same business for more than 20 years. All my brothers and sisters and their families work in the business.

I have a sewing work shop inside my house, so I usually work in the production. 

My biggest accomplishment is that I have a house and some financial stability, in the future I will like to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy fabric for underwear production.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water, but not electricity. 

Mwanasiti has operated a fruit juice-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the near future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes and passion fruits, for making fruit juice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes and passion fruits, for making fruit juice.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a forty three-year-old man; he is married to Elizabeth and blessed with four children.  He owns a workshop in the Zambezi market on the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in the business for ten years, and gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This will be his fourth loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan to purchase trappers and other working tools. 

He wants to expand the business with the profits, and reach more clients. In future, he wants to be a prosperous business man.

loans.use: To buy trappers

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: Cinthia es madre de una niña discapacitada, por esta razón debe trabajar desde su casa, ella compra plata y otros metales para fabricar bisutería cuya clientela es mayormente los comercios  de la ciudad donde vive, también vende el producto directamente a las personas que llegan a adquirirlo hasta su hogar. Debido a los tratamientos y medicamentos especiales de alto costo que debe estar dándole a su hija, ella necesita incrementar sus ventas y ha pensado hacerlo a través de la web, para esto solicita un préstamo de un millón ciuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) con este dinero comprará "plata" y otros metales con los que elaborará bisutería de calidad, y le generará mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cinthia is the mother of a disabled child and for this reason must work from home. She buys silver and other metals for making costume jewelry, and her clientele is mainly businesses in the city where she lives. She also sells the product directly to people who come to her home to buy it. 

Due to the treatments and special high-cost medicines that she must give her daughter, she needs to increase her sales and has thought of doing so through the web. For this, she is requesting a loan of 1,040,000 colones. With this money she will buy silver and other metals to use in making her quality costume jewelry, and this will generate greater income.

loans.use: To buy materials for making costume jewelry.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 49 years old, and owns and manages a sari-sari store and carinderia (mini-restaurant). He has been engaged in this kind of business for twenty-one years. He is requesting a loan amount of PHP 50,000 to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks, grocery items, charcoal and as bigger capitalization. This is due to the high demand of his offered services.  As of now, he is still working hard to provide the needs of his family. He always thinks of and sees to the welfare of his loved ones. He just hopes that his requested loan will be provided.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks, grocery items, charcoal and as bigger capitalization

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman and has four children aged between eighteen and twenty-nine years. She runs a water filtering business, which is located in a busy area. Mary plans to use the loan to buy more bottles to use in her business. She has done this business for five years, and her customers are shops that sell drinking water. Mary faces a challenge of slow movement of the drinking water. But, Mary is optimistic and plans to use the anticipated profits to start other shops for selling water. She has another business running a school, where she earns extra income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bottles to use in the drinking water business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man and has two children. He has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES which he will use to buy more tools and timber for his carpentry business. He has been in the business for two years. The business is located near a town and his customers are locals of the area. The challenge he faces is scarcity of timber.

He intends to use the profits from the business to expand his business.The client is a focused man.

loans.use: to buy more timber and tools to use in carpentry

loans.name: Irene Esperanza

texts.en:
My name is Irene. I am 25 years old and live with my partner in my parents house.

I started working with my grandmother 10 years ago, we used to sell candies and stationary outside an elementary school. 3 years ago, I started my own business selling roasted chicken in a rented local at the Solidaridad Market.

My biggest accomplishment is sending my daughter to school and having some financial stability. 

I am calling the project Rostisería Poi-Pio and believe in providing my clients with great flavor at cheap prices. I will use the loan to buy a larger oven, that way I will be able to attend more clients and grow my business.






I

loans.use: buy a larger oven for her roasting chicken business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man aged 39 years, and has 2 children between ages 2 and 4 years. He has been a farmer for ten years and sees himself as a large-scale farmer in five years time. He is a joyful man and hopes to have a productive farming business in the future. His customers are the local residents.

He plans to use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. 

Richard also does dairy farming, where he earns other income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Presicur

texts.en: Presicur is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, kale, and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for 2 years; her business is located in an urban area where there are many customers. Presicur describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expansion. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to to buy stock of tomatoes, kale, and other groceries. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business and meet public demand. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, kale, and other groceries

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a baker, baking pastries in Wegbe, Hohoe. Hellen has received formal education to the middle school level. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is into farming. Hellen began baking for her livelihood before she got married and has been doing it since to support her husband. She has been baking for the past 16 years. She is responsible for the basic needs of the home and helps her husband to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour, buckets of margarine, and bags of sugar. She hopes to save use the new profits from her business and reinvest back into her business so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, buckets of margarine, and bags of sugar for her bakery

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man aged 38 years who has three children and has been selling sofa sets for eight years. He operates in a busy area and plans to use the loan to buy materials and timber for making sofa sets. He is faced with the challenge of lack of sufficient funds. The customers are the local residents. John sees himself as having expanded the business in five years time. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber and materials for making sofa sets.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
This marks Eunice's third time borrowing after repaying her previous loan successfully. She has since increased the stock in her shop, and she is doing great. 

Currently, she has opened a second shop in her estate to cater to the increasing demand for electrical goods. She hopes to continue growing into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase more bulbs, electrical wires and sockets.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. Her beauty salon business is located in Nakuru town. She describes herself as optimistic. The loan will be used to expand her salon business and she is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES through SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. She is also involved in a dairy and farming business. The profits made will be used to educate her children. The type of customers there are local residents.

loans.use: To expand for her salon business.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is a fish vendor from the town of Getafe, Bohol.  She is a married and the mother of two children.  Her husband works as a fisherman. This is the source of their income.

Melecia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for fishing. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Audia

texts.en:
Audia is a customer of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited who has been with the institution for some time. She is married and has five children. She and her family live in Lyantonde, Uganda. 

Audia deals in cattle fattening and wants to buy more calves with this loan. In addition to selling cows, she also sells milk. Her major challenge is a lack of working capital. She would greatly appreciate having her loan funded.

loans.use: To buy calves to sell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Stephanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Stephanie is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Stephanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipent.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is a Cameroonian, married with four children, living in a rural area. The oldest child is 12 and in secondary school and the youngest is three years old and in nursery school. Anastasie has been in this business for the past ten years which makes her very experienced, stable and successful. I think she is going to succeed because of her long experience in this business. This being her first loan from us, she will use this money to increase her stock by 25 percent and her output by 45 percent as well as increasing her living standard.

loans.use: buy textilesand materials for the making of clothes

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
Fancy is a farmer who lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for four years. Her primary source of income is milk and eggs.

She stated that the most enjoyable part about farming is "selling farm products."

Her biggest challenge is "lack of enough market and capital to expand business."

Fancy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because it has low interest rates and has a grace period."  

This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Microfinance helps improve one's living standards."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Fancy said, "It will help to generate more income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Fancy owns the following: cow, poultry. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net."

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Las Quimeñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS QUIMEÑAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de pollos a la broster, tienda de barrio, compra y venta de mineral, venta de ropa, venta de pan, jardinero.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina, azúcar, arroz) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS QUIMEÑAS” will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the "Centro Focal de Patacamaya". The group is comprised of eight members and is governed by a Board of Directors led by Cristina, their President. The members of the communal association work in a variety of activities including: selling candy, selling fried chicken, running a neighbourhood store, buying and selling minerals, selling clothes, selling bread and gardening. 

The loan they take out will benefit these small-business owners including Cristina. She states that this is her fourth cycle working with Pro Mujer (For Women). She became a member after being invited to do so by a Pro Mujer promoter who visited her home.  She currently has a neighbourhood shop, a business which she started on her own initiative. 

The loan will be used to increase resources; to purchase flour, sugar and rice from markets in the city of El Alto. These items will later be sold at her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can. She is married and has two children. 

When people ask her why she likes Pro Mujer (For Women), she answer is that she likes its focus on health.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Antawara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANTAWARAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía, elaboración y venta de mantas y ponchos, venta de ganado vacuno, producción de papa, venta de chompas, venta de papa y chuño, venta de ganado porcino.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió gracias a la herencia en lanas que le dejo su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Antawaras communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center.  It is comprised of eight members and is headed by a board with Adela as the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied.  Among them are handicrafts, making and selling blankets and ponchos, selling cattle, potato production, selling sweaters, selling regular and freeze-dried potatoes, and selling pigs.

The loan will benefit small business people such as Adele.  She says that this is her first time being a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who visited Adele at her house.

She currently has a business of crafts made from wool.  She says that she undertook this business thanks to an inheritance of wool that her mother left her.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wool).  She will get the wool at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  She will later make things, and she will sell them at the space where she sells.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Gryson

texts.en: Gryson is 53 years old. He is married and has eleven children, who are all in school. He runs a Micro-Distribution Centre (MDC), where he sells Coca-Cola products wholesale to local retailers and customers in his hometown of Lusaka. He has been running this business since 1995, and it is his only source of income. Gryson describes himself as persistent and hardworking. These qualities have helped him continue running his business. He says the main challenge that he faces is that he does not have enough working capital to increase his stock levels. He has empty crates of soft drinks, but does not have the $3000 required for him to buy more soft drinks. Gryson believes that the Kiva loan will help him alleviate his major challenge of lack of stock. He is hopeful that by getting a Kiva loan, he will be able to expand his business and earn more profit so that he can provide a better life for his family. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks so that he can increase his stock levels

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman who lives in Lusaka, Zambia. She has a 16-year-old son and takes care of her extended family's needs, thanks to the revenue that she earns from her business as a Coca-Cola distributor. She is 37 years old. Before Josephine started running her own business, she worked as a house helper for six years. She then decided to open her own business as the money she was earning was not enough to support her family. Her business deals in selling Coca-Cola products to people in her community on wholesale and retail. Josephine's major challenge in running her business is the lack of enough stock. This is because she does not have enough empty crates to enable her to order more stock. The number of drinks she can order is limited by the number of empty crates and amount of money she has. It is for this reason that Josephine has requested a Kiva loan. Once she gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more empty crates so that she can order more stock. Josephine's biggest dream is to see her son through college.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks to increase her stock levels

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is still farming in Ndunyu Njeru. He was able to repay his previous loans in good time and he was also able to get good harvest after investing during the previous planting season. 

He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy farm inputs and a cow. He hopes to become a major livestock dealer in his area in the near future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and a cow.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man with children who still attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

He has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past year selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by debtors who purchased goods on credit from his kiosk.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 50-year-old married man. He has 9 children with ages ranging from 14 to 24 years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a firewood supply store where he sells firewood. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. 

Robert's business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to to buy a motorbike for use in his business. His business goal is to be a big supplier within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy one motorbike

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 23-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be courageous. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, salt, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are wholesale and retail. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the weather. He will use the 10,000 KES loan for agricultural production for agricultural production to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops. His business goal is to be a commercial businessman within 5 years.

loans.use: for agricultural production to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a dairy farm where she has dairy cattle and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the weather changes. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to  buy more cows  for dairy and also buy seeds and fertilizers for growing crops. Her business goal is to be stable and successful within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to  buy more cows  for dairy and also buy seeds and fertilizers for growing crops

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a carpentry business where he make furniture to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more items for his carpentry business like timber and nails. His business goal is to have a big workshop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more items for his carpentry business like timber and nails

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport and drastic weather changes. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
My name is Guillermina, I sell Jafra cosmetics from door to door through a catalog. I am 63 years old and for the last 30 years I have done multiple activities to earn income such as: rent rooms and buy a taxi and hire someone to drive it, I also rent a truck for a Mexican TV talk show called Laura Bozzo. My slogan is: "Beauty comes first"My biggest accomplishments has been being able to buy a house, a taxi, a truck but most important is sending my kids to college.  

I want the loan to pay some loans from a pawn shop, get back my jewelry and stop paying extremely high interest rates. 

I am a persistent woman and always pay my loans.

loans.use: to get her jewelry back from a pawn shop and pay lower interest rates

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
I am 51 years old, single and live with some relatives.
I have a small grapic design shop since 2000 and make posters, signs, vinil tarps, etc.
Our slogan is: " Tu lo imaginas y nosotros lo hacemos" which means "You imagine it and we will do it".

Using computers, we do all kinds of signs for business, cars, and taxis. 

My biggest accomplishment are buying a car, furniture, and remodeling my home. My goal is expanding my business by opening another printing local. 

The loan will be used for debt consolidation and improving my personal finances. With the savings that I will get from lower monthly payments, I will be able to put more money in my business. 

I have payed all my loans on time.

loans.use: To repay very expensive debts and improve cash flow.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
My name is Yolanda, I am 43 years old, 4 years ago my husband left me. I have a daughter, that just had a little baby, she is a single mother. 

I have a grocery store, which I have had for the last 16 years old. My daughter works with me, and we have a lot of regular clients because we provide them very good service. My daughter had a baby two weeks ago, so she is not able to work at the moment. I work and cover all her expenses, including food, diapers and medicines for the baby. 

I am a fighter and always look out for my daughter. 

I will use the loan to buy groceries to get more variety and more products in my store, because a person that used to work for me stole some merchandise that I had bought with an other loan, despite these problem, I have continued to sell and pay the loan. 

I open monday through saturday from 7:30am a 12:30 am and sundays from 9:00 am to 12:30am. All my life is dedicated to working and helping my family, I cook and eat in the store.

My biggest accomplishment is taking care of my daughter and buying a car, that I lease and receive additional income.

I am responsible and even after going through dificult times, I keep fighting an dpaying my loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries for my store and repay a very expensive loan.

loans.name: Velma

texts.en:
Velma lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming:rearing livestock. Her biggest challenge is poor weather conditions. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Chepkuinet.

Velma was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It will help meet family needs.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'It gives loans to poor farmers.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, she said it will improve their standards of living.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Velma owns the following: cow, poultry, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: constructing a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has three children and has been doing this work for three years.  His primary income source is eggs and crops.

He stated that the most enjoyable thing about farming is earning from selling agricultural products. His biggest challenge is limited access to finance.

Wilson was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. He replied that he joined Juhudi after a friend in Juhudi Kilimo advised of the benefit to the farmers. Wilson was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said that he learned how Juhudi works to boost farmers' income generation.

When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Wilson said he would purchase a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wilson owns poultry but does not own cows, pigs, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ndiamboufall Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée depuis le 21 septembre 2012 et regroupe 20 membres très solidaires et dynamiques avec comme activités principales le commerce et l'agriculture. 
Absatou la responsable du groupe est mariée, âgée de 30 ans.Elle fait le petit commerce d'arachide et d'huile de palme et la culture de mil, de maïs. Elle a une expérience d'environ 10 ans dans ce domaine et ses activités s'articulent autour du marché de son village.Elle est debout à droite habillée en marron et a levé haut la main gauche.
Elle compte acheter deux fûts d’arachides de 28500 francs l'un et de l'huile de palme pour une valeur de 20000 francs.
Elle connait bien la vente d'huile de palme et d'arachide et les gens du village sont très intéressées par ses produits.
Avec ses bénéfices elle compte épargner pour atteindre une autonomie et recycler le reste pour maximiser ses profits.
texts.en:
The group was created on 21 September 2012 and is composed of 20 members, who are close with each other and dynamic. Their main activities include commerce and agriculture. 

Absatou, the leader of the group, is married and 30 years old. She sells palm oil and grows millet, corn, and groundnuts. She has an experience of about ten years in this area and her business is conducted mostly in the village market. 

She hopes to buy two containers of groundnuts for 28,500 francs each. She is a good seller of groundnuts and the people of the village are very interested in her products. 

With her earnings, Absatou hopes to save in order to be able to support herself and will use the rest to maximize her profits.

loans.use: Achat d'huile de palme et achat d'arachides

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 15 Octobre 2012  à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles commencent à  comprendre le programme car étant au deuxième cycle. Des qualités comme  solidarité et l’esprit d’épargne commencent à émerger. Ces  femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadidiatou (assise à l’extrême droite dans le deuxième ranger), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans  est  mariée et mère neuf enfants dont cinq garçons.  Elle est tient table au village où elle vend du sucre, du thé, des bonbons et batteries pour recharge radio et torche. 

Avec son  nouveau prêt elle compte acheter un sacre de sucre à 20 000 F CFA un carton de piles grand et petit modèle et des sachets de bonbons à la menthe pour la revente au village.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle tient à mieux assister son  mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women from the same village. It was established on October 15. 2012, when their Banc Villageois was inaugurated. They start to understand the program since they are seeking their second loan. Qualities such as solidarity and a savings state of mind start to emerge. These women's main business is retail.

Mrs. Kadidiatou (sitting on the far right in the second row) is the group's featured borrower. She's 33 years old, married, and the mother of nine children, five of whom are boys. She has a stall in the village, where she sells sugar, tea, candies, and batteries to power radios and flashlights.

With this new loan, she intends to buy one sack of sugar costing XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40), one box of batteries (large and small sizes), and bags of mint candies to resell in the village.

With the profits earned from her business, she wants to better help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of sugar, one box of batteries, and bags of mint candies

loans.name: Bahaba

texts.en:
Bahaba is a married woman with four children; she describes herself to be honest. 

Bahati operates a firewood retail store, where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenges to be the scarcity of firewood, and harassment from law enforcers. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy a stock of firewood to sell.  

Bahaba hopes that in the future she will own a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Pictured above is Patrick, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. Born in Yeaben, which is in northern Sierra Leone, the 39-year-old is married to a businesswoman. The couple has three children who attend primary schools. Patrick has been a staff member at his company for 10 years now. 

In addition to his work at the company, Patrick is also an agriculturist. He has requested this loan in order to invest in his farm. 

Staff members at various institutions typically come to SMT for loans. With the help of these loans, they are able to meet certain financial criteria that they could not meet with their salaries alone. At the end of each month, a finance officer will deduct their payments in order to repay SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Las Nubes Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA  LÓPEZ ES UNA MUJER HUMILDE,TRABAJADORA,RESPONSABLE,SOLIDARIA CON UNA BEBE DE 3 AÑOS. ELLA TIENE 20 AÑOS DE HABITAR EN LA COMARCA LAS NUBES DEL MUNICIPIO DE CHICHIGALPA, TIENE 3 AÑOS DE TENER SU NEGOCIO Y LO EJERCE A DIARIO.

LE HA TOCADO VIVIR UNA VIDA MUY DURA, GRACIAS A DIOS SIEMPRE HA TENIDO EL APOYO DE SU MARIDO QUE ESTA EN COSTA RICA, AUN ASI ELLA HA SALIDO ADELANTE CON LA VENTA DE COSMETIOS,ROPA NUEVA Y LA VENTA DE CRIANZA DE CERDOS, DEBIDO A LA SITUACION ECONOMICA DE NUESTRO PAIS.

ELLA EN UN FUTURO SUEÑA CON TENER SU PROPIA CASITA Y VER SU NEGOCIO GRANDE,ESPERA QUE CEPRODEL Y LA ORGANIZACION KIVA LE DEN MAS OPORTUNIDADES PARA CUMPLIR SUS METAS PROPUESTAS.
texts.en:
Angelica is a humble, responsible, hardworking young woman who has a 3-year-old daughter. For the last 20 years, Angelica has lived in the community of Las Nubes, in the municipality of Chichigalpa. She makes a living running a cosmetics and clothing sales business, and she also raises pigs.

Life has not been easy for Angelica, but thankfully she has always had her husband's support, even though he is in Costa Rica. Angelica pours her efforts into her two businesses, and she works very hard to make a way for herself. In the future, Angelica dreams of owning her own home and growing her business, and she hopes that the investment of this loan will help her along the path to achieving those dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing for resale at her business.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Meet Mustapha, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. He has been a staff member at the sugar company for seven years now. 

In addition to his work at the company, he is also a farmer and has been doing farming for six years now.  Mustapha has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 in order to invest it in his farm. 

The 38-year-old Mustapha was born in Magbass village, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a farmer, and they have three children attending primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: to invest in his farm.

loans.name: Rene Lucio

texts.es: Don Rene vive en casa propia con su esposa y su mama, se dedica a la crianza y ordeño de vacas y tambien a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz, con las ventas que realiza de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Rene esta solicitando un credito para comprar los insumos necesarios para cosechar 5 manzanas de maiz y tambien para mejorar el terreno donde piensa sembrar que es el que muestra la fotografia, para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Don Rene lives in his own home with  his wife and his mother. He rears cattle and also grows crops. His main crop is corn. With the sales of his crops, he is able to cover some household costs. Rene is requesting a loan for the purchase of the necessary supplies for harvesting 8.5 acres of corn and to improve the land where he plans to plant crops (shown in the photograph). He is doing this in order to obtain a greater income and to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 46-year-old married man with four children ranging from five to 27 years old. For the past 20 years, Peter has operated a farm where he grows tea to sell. His business is located in an area with many customers. Peter's biggest business challenge is high transport fees. He describes himself as aggressive. 

Peter is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to pay school fees. His business goal is to become a large-scale farmer within five years. This is Peter's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 32-year-old married mother with 3 children, the eldest being 12 and youngest being 4. She describes herself as a confident and determined mother. 

She is applying for a kes 20,000 loan through SMEP DTM that she will use to purchase kale, onions and potatoes as inventory. Her major challange is transportation costs but she can see herself in the near future having a chain of grocery stores. The profits made from the business will be used in enhancing her family's welfare. 

This is her first application for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase kale, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Nzaka

texts.en:
Nzaka lives in Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has two children, neither of whom attend school. He is a fisherman, a trade he has run for twelve years. He is also a farmer.

He learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the fluctuating market due to seasonality and the perishability of his products.

Nzaka is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy fishing nets. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to cater for the needs of the family. His plan for the future is to expand into wholesale fish mongering.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Worokhiya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village.Elles ont pour activité principale le maraîchage.

Celle qui léve la main sur la photo,est la responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 53 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité consiste à s'occuper d'un périmétre de jardin pour cultiver des légumes et de la salade.

Elle compte acheter de l'engrais et des semences avec son prêt.

Son objectif est de contribuer aux charges liées à la scolarité des enfants et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2009. It is composed of members who are from the same village and who engage primarily in market gardening. 

The one whose hand is raised in the photo is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old and is married and a mother of five children. 

She manages a perimeter of a garden and cultivates vegetables and lettuce. She hopes to buy fertilizer and seeds with her loan. 

Her goal is to contribute to the expenses related to her children's schooling and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Albercio

texts.es: Don albercio vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, el se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. Don albercio quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Albercio lives with his life partner in a home they own. He has had a business selling clothing for several years, and because of his experience he has been able to earn more income. He runs the business out of his home, and he has a lot of customers because people know that he sells high-quality items at reasonable prices. Albercio would like to invest more in his business but he does not have enough working capital, so he is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, and everything else he needs for his business. This investment will allow him to pay off his debt and, he hopes, provide economic security.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 60 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 10, 3 and 1 years old. He earns a living with his retail shop, and his clients are the people around the Ntara Trading Centre in Kamwenge District. He is requesting a loan to buy more retail materials. Apart from retail, Thomas also deals in coffee and matooke sales. He hopes to have a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and other items to sell

loans.name: Willington

texts.en: Willington is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children, two and four years old. He describes himself as experienced and determined. He operates a retail store where he sells household goods. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an environment that is conducive for his business. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to his stock of household goods. This is his second loan from SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to add to his stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 48-year-old married man with three children. He describes himself as a trustworthy father and he struggles to provide for his family. He has been running the business for the past five years and describes the area as being profitable for business. 

Charles is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 that will be used to purchase rice, flour, sugar, and bread for his store. The anticipated profits will be used to open another shop in a different area so as to increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour, sugar, and bread for his store.

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ajabu est leader du groupe de crédit « Manne du ciel », entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Son conjoint est un maçon constructeur. La cliente est propriétaire d’une moto qui fait le taxi urbain. En outre, elle est vendeuse d’arachides. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter une nouvelle moto. Les accidents de circulation et routiers sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et construire une maison. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit.
texts.en: The client, Ajabu, is the leader of the loan group "Manne du ciel". She is a courageous entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has 6 children. Her spouse is a mason. The client owns a motorbike which she uses as an urban taxi. In addition, she also sells peanuts. She started her business with money from her husband. This new loan will help her buy a new motorbike. Traffic and road accidents are big obstacles for the growth of her business. In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house. She thanks Hekima for their microfinance support.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: She has managed to expand her business, she is now dealing with a larger area of customers who come to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 29 year-old mother of three children. She describes herself as honest. She is involved in the selling of second hand clothes and has been running this business for two years.  The market environment is busy and most of her customers come from various areas. She is applying for a loan of kes 30,000 which will be used to purchase cloth sheet,needles and threads for sewing clothes in her tailoring business. This is her 2nd application for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase cloth sheet,needles and threads for sewing clothes in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en:
For the past four years, Fadhila has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to local neighbours. 
With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to establish a food stall business, purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 40 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol vive con su familia en casa propia, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia con las ganacias que obtiene de sus evntas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y frijol y tambien para mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos. para poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Manuel is 40 years old and he lives with his family in a house of his own. He is a farmer planting corn and beans. He is a hardworking person and he is very responsible with his household's obligations, and offering the best to his family is his main characteristic. By selling his products he earns an income he uses to pay for his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and tools he needs for his corn and beans crops; he also wants to make improvements to his land that is shown in the picture and where he plants his crops, in order to earn a better income and to grant his family a better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, weed-killers and tools.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: Remberto de 44 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa de su propiedad y desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y frijol con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: Remberto is 44 years old. He lives with his wife in their house on his property. For many years now, he has been farming, which is his main source of income. He grows corn and kidney beans; he is able to meet some of his household expenses by selling his crops. He would like to purchase the supplies he needs to farm the land - such as compost, fertilizer, seeds - and he would like to enrich the soil (shown in the photo) where he grows his crops. However, as he does not have the means to make such an investment, he has decided to ask for a loan, since this is the only way he can continue to farm. Just like any other farmer, he trusts in farming as he does not have other means of income; he hopes to do better by doing as much as he can to improve his yield. He is hoping to get a plentiful harvest so that he can continue to provide for the daily needs of his family and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer to improve the soil

loans.name: Pranvera

texts.en:
Pranvera, this 32-year-old married mother of two school aged children, 13 and 7 years old, lives in southeastern Albania with the rest of her family. 
According to Pranvera, never before she has asked for a loan from any financial institution, because she knew that her application would be turned down due to the lack of collateral and an inability to pay back the monthly installment (principal plus interest). 

Here is what Pranvera had to say while interviewed: “I had never even thought that someday I would be able to receive a loan, let alone not having to pay the interest. I am so, so happy for all this, and I don’t know who to thank first: the VFA, KIVA lenders or WVA for this wonderful project and opportunity they give to poor like myself?” she said smiling. “Thanks to all, I am now able to add another milk cow to my other one, and this definitely will increase the dairy produce and my family’s income" Pranvera added.

loans.use: to add another milk cow.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a permanent resident of Mbarara municipality. He is 61 years old. He is married and has eight children and two dependents.  All his children and dependents go to school. He was a soldier in the Ugandan military forces, but he retired early because he was injured in a bomb blast that affected his back.

After his retirement, Alex resorted to poultry farming, which enabled him and his family to survive.  This activity made him prosper in life, and even helped him to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate his family.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX, which he will use to buy materials for the completion of the house.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
For the past years, Mwanajuma has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of transportation as her major challenge. Mwanajuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. The previous loan has been of great help to her life, and she appreciates it, very much. 

With the KES 50,000 of this new loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell, like maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a permanent resident of Bugamba a village in Ntungamo district.  He is 47 years-old.  He is a retired church priest and he is married with six children and two other dependents who are the children of his uncle and he is entrusted with educating them. All his children and dependents are in school. From childhood, he has been a farmer dealing in banana sales. 

In 2008, when  he learnt about the existence of Kiva partner UGAFODE micro finance which funded him with a loan of 2,000,000 in order to improve his plantations. This made him prosper in life and he managed to build a semi permanent house to accommodate his family.  

He is requesting for a loan of 2,500,000 in order to buy a solar panel for his home since he is located in a village where there is no hydro power.

In the photograph Wilson is with his wife right in front of their home.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 31-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 4 years and 8 years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail store where he supplies bread and also sells spare parts of bicycles and motorcycles. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more bread and spare parts for selling. His business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more bread and spare bicycle and motorcycle parts for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells clothes in her boutique in Naivasha town. 

After paying a previous loan on time, she has applied for her third loan from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business and pay school fees with her anticipated profits.
